name: Chancellor Hotel on Union Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Chancellor in December and had a wonderful experience! It was our honeymoon and they were nice enough to give us champage to celebrate! The location is fantastic and Union Square has so much to see and do. The beds were really comfortable and the service from all hotel staff was great. The only downside was one night we wanted to have a drink in the lounge but they had to close early. However there were plenty of other places close by so it was not a big deal. Overall this hotel is a great value and we will stay here again when we come back to San Francisco.
reviews.title: loved the Chancellor
excellent location, pretty quiet, nice staff
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Chancellor 2 or 3 times, and it has become the place I stay when in SFO. The attractions are in order of attactiveness: location, staff attitude, quietness. The location works for most of the Market/business dist area and I stay here for Moscone conferences as well. The place is consistently well staffed by people who notice you and ask if they can help in a proactive fasion. The rooms are a bit small, but that's what you get with an older property. And with an older property you also get more solid and quiet construction. I found most of the fixtures in the room of higher than average quality. Everything worked in my rooms there. There is no exercise equipment there, but I never care in SFO since it's a walkers paradise. While the property itself doesn't have some of the things I usually associate with an excellent rating, the location and value of this hotel combined with the consistent service level propels to this level.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights over the Christmas period and had an excellent stay. We originally booked on the strength of the previous reviews and the very reasonable price we got (including parking), not to mention the great location a stone's throw from Union Square, the trolley stop and loads of shopping. We were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel!

likes.disliked: — honestly can't think of anything - it was a great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is attractive, clean and recently renovated. Our room was on the small side, but this wasn't a problem - it was well appointed and had a very comfortable bed. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the little bar in the lobby was great to grab a quick night cap after a long day out! The free popcorn and freshly baked cookies were also a nice touch.
reviews.title: A little gem in busy Union Square

likes.disliked: — Nothing - got exactly what we were expecting (in fact slightly more)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007
reviews.text: All in all, a gem of a hotel and definitely recommended.
reviews.title: A wee gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: An excellent value for what it is - a three star hotel. Though the rooms are a bit small and showing their age and the lobby a bit utilitarian, the Chancellor works hard to provide four/five star amenities in the room (iron, safe) and lobby (cookies, concierge, etc.). Great location. I recommend the hotel room and parking 'bundle' - very convenient. Strictly self-service which I prefer. Check in, check out, delivery of the car all handled perfectly. I probably would not stay there with my family, but I would definitely stay there again on my own.
reviews.title: Excellent Value for Business Traveller

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With a selection of pillows, a great location, friendly staff and an amazing price, we were completely happy with everything about this hotel... except that it's in San Francisco. Ah well, you can't have it all.
reviews.title: Even Captain America and Spiderman would stay here

likes.disliked: — Being surrounded by hippies once I left the hotel.

reviews.title: Wonderful Stay, Great Staff
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed their after a business meeting I attended in San Jose, CA. A friend suggested this hotel and she described it perfectly. Great Location, Clean Rooms, and Friendly knowledgably staff. We are not interested in getting caught up in the tourist traps of the city. The staff knew exactly where to send us for some Great Meals. Thanks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: T. Thompson, Rhode Island
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Chancellor on 2 occasions, the last being Feb 2006. I would like to say that I think this hotel is really good. The rooms are kept very clean, nice and bright, beds are comfortable too. This hotel enjoys a great location on Union Square for everything. Very convenient to catch the cable car too. Yes this hotel is old and in my opinion its kept very well by all the staff. The breakfast is excellent in the restaraunt and I can particularly recommend the daily fruit shakes! waiter was also very friendly. There is really only one thing that was slightly annoying.. on my second visit there, after checking in we went to our room and after 45 mins our luggage did not arrive! I called the front desk and was told they were on their way... after a further 30 mins I went down to reception only to find them in the same spot that I left them, right by the front desk so I took them up to the room myself. A minor point I agree, however it was pouring with rain in San Francisco so we were wet and really needed a change of clothes, otherwise I would not have minded this but there was no apology given whatsoever. Besides this, I would have no hesitation in staying here again on my future visits to SFO. Thanks... manager and staff do a great job - keep it up!
reviews.title: Expect Some Quirks and You'll Be Fine

likes.disliked: — Small room (but I knew it would be)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the location was fantastic and the hotel workers were friendly and helpful, the cleaning products they were using in the hotel rooms could strip paint off an aircraft carrier. Seriously, they were using some sort of scented carpet powder or the like when cleaning the rooms and it immediately caused headaches for the two of us. We really weren't in a position to search out another room in town so we opened the windows, turned the ceiling fan on full blast and kept up the "don't make up this room sign" our entire stay. I would easily recommend this hotel if it wasn't for the head-splitting experience.
reviews.title: Watch out for cleaning fumes
Perfect location
reviews.text: When I reached out to the general manager, he said that usually they usually were able to deal with guest's idiosyncrasies...a term that I took offense with. No one should have to put up with obnoxious cleaning fumes in their rooms. Earlier I had approached the front desk for a solution, was offered none except for a quip by the desk clerk who said that her boyfriend would be unable to stay at the hotel because of the cleaning products.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Hotel accommodated our needs completely. Staff was very congenial and approachable. They greeted us each time we returned to the hotel and were extremely helpful and friendly. Room was comfortable and location made access to sights and BART very easy. Looking forward to our next visit. Will definitely stay at the Chancellor again.
reviews.title: very nice room & excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a great hotel in almost every aspect. The location is excellent -- easily reachable from the airport on BART, convenient to Market Street, Union Square, and Chinatown, and with dozens of restaurants in close proximity. The rooms aren't large (think European) but very well furnished, with a small desk, table, and chairs. The bathroom has a nice set of amenities, and the walk-in closet is huge. Moreover, the room has free wireless Internet, and the lobby always has free coffee, tea, and cookies. Very nice room, and excellent value!
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very spacious room, with internet, complimentary water, coffee and tea and cookies in the lobby. clean neat and comfortable bed, we arrived midnight after a long flight of 26 hrs from australia and found front room on Powell street noisy. We asked to be moved and without any problem we were moved to a back room, our luggage moved for us when room was available, so we got on with our day. Lovely bath with bath salts as a bonus. Great margaritas at happy hour, however the breakfast can definitely be improved. We had a wonderful breakfast next door at sears restaurant, it is a must !
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in San Francisco!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We found many positive reviews of the Chancellor on Trip Advisor.com and, along with the price, this enticed us to skip out of the conference hotel (Nikko) and try this family-owned hotel. The location cannot be beaten being just a few steps north from Union Square and across the street from a cable car stop. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed the bartender/server in the small but well-stocked bar. There seemed to be some local regulars that stopped in and despite the small space, it was a lovely place to have drinks before heading out to dinner. The drinks too were incredibly reasonable in price which brought us back each afternoon. We ate breakfast two of our three mornings and enjoyed delicious omlets and eggs benedicts for again a very low prices compared to other hotel breakfasts. The rooms were small (to be expected in an old hotel), not alot of excess space to move around in but it was clean and quiet. As we were on the go alot, this simple place to come back to from a day out sightseeing, shopping, and conferencing was just fine. Be sure, if you are used to chain or luxury hotels, the Chancellor might initally make you think you are going to be roughing it but rest assured, you'll enjoy your time there. We definitely will be staying there on future visits to San Francisco.
reviews.title: The Chancellor was friendly, convenient, and perfect for a visit to SF spent on the go.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: Stayed here 2 weeks ago, fantastic location of Union Square, booked thru Trailfinders, staying 5 nights but only paying for 4.
reviews.title: Fantastic location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was very efficient and quick, stayed on 5th floor with a Powell Street view, didn't find it noisy , great view of Union Square saw the Chinese New Year parade.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at the Chancellor hotel - good location, clean and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Room was on the small size, maybe needs a lick of paint, but it was still good, bathroom was definitely bijou but it had the deepest bath I've seen!
reviews.title: A wonderful gem in an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were very friendly, even the overnight front desk staff who I bumped into every morning when I went running, the lobby didn't seem crowded, didn't use the bar and restaurant, but the gift shop was very helpful, it is where you can buy Muni ticket and also book your ride to the airport.
reviews.title: Classic boutique hotel and a great value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: A great small hotel right in the centre of union square, close to all the great shops ,trams running past outside.I have never been to a hotel before which has a pillow menu or umbrellas in the rooms.the staff were exceptional here as we had to organise faxs and so helpful,wonderful free cookies and coffee in the mornings,great value for money,will have to come back
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I had the unique experience of staying at the Chancellor Hotel in San Francisco, California. All I can say is WOW! I was sent to San Francisco for training. I am not a traveler. I rarely leave home without my husband. SO it was quite a surprise to me when my Boss said I would be going away (by myself) for two weeks, possibly 16 weeks I know nothing about big City living and I was scared. I went to The Chancellor's website to see what was available. There was a link to contact the manager so I did. I mentioned that I would be in the City alone and that I was afraid. When I checked in I got a big surprise as I was upgraded to a SUITE on the 15th floor! The Room was beautifully charming. It is not a brand new hotel but a cozy and historic building from around 1914. The bed was comfortable. The pillows were wonderful. They even have a pillow menu where you can order up what ever type of pillow you are used to sleeping with!! Rooms are very clean and updated with new and trendy furniture. The bathroom has a very deep bath tub which was perfect for taking hot baths after a long days work. Shampoo, conditioner, lotion, cotton balls and even Q-tips are provided. For my second week at the hotel (I went home on the weekend) I did not have the SUITE.. However, I was given a room on the 15th floor that was equally as cozy and comfortable. Since I was staying for 5 days and wanted to have cold waters, I called down to the front desk and asked if they had a refrigerator that they could bring to me. They brought it up right away! Both rooms that I stayed in had a beautiful view of Union Square. I felt safe to walk around this area. This Hotel is in the Heart of things. You can easily catch a taxi or any other public transportation by just stepping outside of the building. The Staff was extremely friendly. The facility was very clean. The elevators were fast. The bar is small but I had a great time talking to other hotel guests and the Awesome Bartender named Alicia. She made me feel comfortable and even gave recommendations on things to do in San Fran as well as places to eat if I had craving for certain foods. They even have a plug underneath the bar to plug in your phone :) I thought that was cool!! Oh, there was a walk-in closet in both of my rooms. In the closet there was a safe where I kept personal items. Lastly I want to say that this hotel is VERY AFFORDABLE! I will be returning to San Francisco and when I do... I will be staying here at The Chancellor! If you want to experience the charm of San Francisco, you will stay here....
reviews.title: A True Gem! San Francisco Charm... WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Chancellor is rather tired looking, we asked for a quiet room and were on the top floor, 15th. Our room was in need of decoration and to get into the room we had to squeeze in and out of the bathroom which was just inside the door. At 3am every morning a strange knocking noise could be heard and at 5am there was a clanging noise which may have been a water or heating system. We mentioned these noises to the management who said nothing could be done. The staff in the breakfast room were offhand and not particularly helpful. My husband had a duvet cover with a hole in it. We booked a tour through the hotel to Yosemite which, for various reasons, was very unsatisfactory. All in all it was a very disappointing stay and we couldn't really recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Trying to find a hotel for our stay in San Francisco was a nightmare, I finally settled on the Chancellor Hotel, it was a good choice, it’s a little old fashioned and that gives it character, service was good, rooms clean. Here’s a tip, breakfast time the hotel provides coffee, tea and lovely soft cookies FOC in reception, that really helped get the day started. Location wise its right on Powell Street, walk to the bottom of the hill and you can get the tram to the piers, the tram does stop right outside the hotel, but you’ll be lucky if you can get on there with a family. Again, down the hill is Macys store with its roof top cheese cake restaurant/café which we visited twice LOL. The start of China Town is just up the hill to the right on California Street. There are a couple of eateries nearby on Powell Street, a couple of independents and two Lories Diner’s one up the hill, one down the hill, all were fine. When it came time to pick up our hire car, I’d pre arranged pick up one block away at the National garage on Bush Street. All in all it couldn’t have worked better and I’d stay at the Chancellor again without a moment hesitation.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was great--We were upgraded to a better room (at no charge). The rooms do not come with a fridge--but just ask! They were more then happy to get one for you. Huge bathtub and yes---there was a rubber ducky. Great value and location. A little noisy on the Union Square side. Jack hammers at 7 am sharp. :)
reviews.title: Honeymoon Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I booked the Chancellor Hotel when I decided to add 2 more nights to an already planned trip to San Francisco. I contacted the hotel directly and received a great rate.
reviews.title: Would Not Hesitate to Stay at the Chancellor Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I had a corner room on the 12th floor that overlooked Union Square. I had read the reviews of the Chancellor on here and was hoping it would live up to the hype. It did. I did not run into any employee who was not friendly or helpful. And they had answers for every question I asked about the hotel and the area.
reviews.title: Great location - Everything close by!!!
Good location
reviews.text: My room was very nice. The bed was comfortable and I really liked the tiled bathroom. It's not a modern an new place, it's quaint and historic. I expected the room to be on the small side, but there was plenty of room to move around. And the closet was so big, you could change inside it! And in there was a safe, an electric radiator, an umbrella, an iron & board and extra bedding.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first day I arrived, it was pretty warm. I just opened the window and turned up the ceiling fan and the room was quite comfortable. I even slept with the window open and the street noise did not bother me.
reviews.title: Chancellor Hotel - a great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free wi-fi was a plus. I did not go to the restaurant or bar. (only because I was not there too long)
reviews.title: Fantastic location,price and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed all over Union Square, and this is a gem! Very quaint and friendly hotel. Rooms with high ceilings, nice bath and great beds. everyone cant stay in a room with a view, but if you can, its a must. The rooms here are much better than the very popular hotel down the street and better than the one across the street. Those hotels have bigger bars and restaurants, but there is something about staying at the Chancellor. You can always walk down the street to the other bar or restaurant. You even get a drink token per day with your stay here. Very nice ;)
reviews.title: Best stay on the Square!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only drawback is the spa and pool is at a remote place, used as a complimetary feature with health Club around the corner.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed at this Hotel on a tour of the west coast of USA. really nice central hotel. A 2 minute walk from the Tram turn. Stones throw from union square, Maceys and Bloomingdales. The breakfast at this hotel was great, lots of choice, plenty of food. I would strongly recommend the steak & eggs, they were lovely. The room was very nice not huge, just right. The bathroom was very clean and the bed was comfy. We felt the price was very very good. two very satisfied customers.
reviews.title: Decent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great if you want to stay downtown. It's across from the Sir Francis Drake Hotel (known for the Starlight Room). Safe area as it is a busy one, convenient to downtown and taxis, nice staff, reasonably priced (though I got a special deal through hotwire). It's rather outdated but still pretty cute, plus hopefully in SF you're spending more time outside than inside the hotel. Small bar with decent drinks (price and quality wise). Rooms and bathrooms are a bit small so if you have a large suitcase, think twice. 2 small rollers and 2 backpacks in a queen/king bed room were fine.
reviews.title: Impressive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I searched quite extensively to find a reasonably priced hotel in San Francisco. Finally decided on Chancellor. I was skeptical because the price was so reasonable, given its location. And I'm quite a picky person so I was prepared to be disappointed.
reviews.title: great hotel - room could be noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband called the hotel when we changed planes in Las Vegas, and asked their advice re which restaurant we should choose for dinner that evening. They helped us make a good choice and they called and made us a dinner reservation. My luggage didn't make our connecting flight, but when we returned to the hotel that evening, my suitcase had been delivered and hotel staff put it in our room -- it was waiting for me there instead of downstairs at the front desk. Front desk was professional, helpful and competent. Soda, water and snacks were available for a reasonable price, and there were ice machines on every floor. The hotel feels classy and refined, with lots of brass and glass. Classic and tastefully understated decor. I rearranged the chairs in the room to give us a little more space -- but everyone says the rooms in SF are always tiny. Our room was small but not tiny. The bed was very comfortable. I didn't realize that they didn't have king beds, but the queen room we had (for a very reasonable price) was more than adequate. Great mattress and pillows. We didn't feel cramped. We are average sized people. If you are larger, you could request room with two twin beds and possibly put them together for a king? The bathroom was small, but very nice, and had a HUGE tub (no jets). They provided bath salts and I took advantage of a nice hot bath after we returned from walking all over SF for most of the day. No A/C, but we didn't need it. You can request a high or low floor, and you can request a "quiet" room. We were on the 10th floor on the back. It was perfect. We had a great view and no noise from the busy street on the front. This hotel is on the cable car line which runs up and down Powell Street. Very convenient. Just walk outside and there is a cable car stop -- you're on your way. The breakfast offered in this hotel was outstanding. Lots of great choices. I had New Orleans Eggs Benedict -- fantastic and fresh! Good coffee and service. Affordable and reasonable. Next door to Sears Inn, which has great swedish pancakes. Easy to get a cab to and from this hotel -- cabbies knew where our hotel was just by providing the name. I can't think of anything negative about this hotel. A great place to stay: great room, happy environment, very convenient location, safe area, close to great restaurants, stores and nightlife. All at a very reasonable price. You don't need to go through all the blind bidding on Priceline.
reviews.title: A Little Gem in the Center of it All

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I had an excellent stay at the Chancellor. From the moment I arrived the staff was welcoming and very helpful, and every staff member I encountered during my stay was very polite. The Chancellor was located perfectly for me. A couple blocks from the conference I was attending, right on the trolley car line, close to many restaurants, and a block from the gym that they are connected with rather than having a small workout facility on site. The gym was a nice bonus, as it was close and the staff there treated me like I was one of their members, getting to participate in group excercise classes as well as have full access to the rest of the workout equipment and the pool. The room was comfortable, and I was able to get a good night's sleep each night, and enjoyed trying out some different pillows from their pillow menu. Staff was helpful with giving directions to anywhere I needed to go and they recommended a great restaurant upon request.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, Great location, Comfortable room, and linked to a full gym

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I am a hotel snob! I was leery of staying at the Chancellor HOWEVER, it was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The staff - fantastic. The location - could not have been better. The atmosphere - great.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: We had adjoining rooms, facing Powell Street, on the fourth floor. I was concerned about the noise level from the cable cars - no problems. We were actually able to go out on the fire escape and watch the Chinese New Year's parade.
reviews.title: Lovely Boutique Hotel - great value and great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The shampoo, conditioners and soap were replenished every day. They had souvenir rubber duckies to play in the (huge) tub with and then bring home, gratis.
reviews.title: All Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed for 6 nights in November in a top floor room away from Powell Street. The room was spotlessly clean, average size and reasonably appointed. Even with the window open there were no noise issues. Rooms have no airconditioning but do have effective ceiling fans which was fine for my stay - sometimes its good to get fresh air! I found the staff to be excellent, friendly and very helpful at all times. I didn't eat in the restaurant, so I can't comment on that.
reviews.title: Excellent older hotel in a prime location

likes.disliked: — lack of in room tea/cofee making

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I have to say the Chancellor is exceptional value, especially given its prime location. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.
reviews.title: Awesome Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here over the 4th of July after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed! The location was awesome...close to shopping and great food, the trolley, and within walking distance of the bay. The staff was friendly and the room had just been redecorated and was great. They were still in the middle of renovating the other side of the floor, but we had no noise problems. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: Loved our stay at the Chancellor

likes.liked: — Location, staff, value, charming ambience - everything

reviews.title: Small rooms but good hotel
reviews.text: Stayed with family (incl 2 teenagers) for 3 nights in December - fantastic location near Union Square, amazing value and super friendly and helpful staff. Special mention to Susan who helped us with last minute city trip and airport transfer. The place has a really charming ambience and lots of character you will not find at other hotels. It was our best hotel experience during our 3 week trip around the US (and we stayed at more expensive and "prestigious" hotels in other cities). When we return to SF from Sydney some time in the future we'll be heading straight for the Chancellor. 5 stars.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for four nights recently and found the hotel was good. It is advertised as all the rooms having been redocorated as recently as November '07 but the bathroom in our room looked only to have had a superficial makeover.
reviews.title: 2nd time- Just as good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed five nights in September as part of attending Oracle Openworld 2010. As such, I was interested in a hotel that was close to SOMA. My room was on the third floor and was very nice. The room was more than large enough for my needs.
reviews.title: Very Nice Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I liked: by far, the walk in closet was really, really helpful; the bathroom had cotton swabs--nice touch; the room was so quiet that I never heard anyone else except once, quite amazing; service was great--I got exactly what I asked for, usually quite quickly; real bathtub; variety and number of pillows; very friendly hotel staff; free coffee in the mornings was quite tasty; the fitness club was great!; ventilation was good, even on hot (80's F) days;
reviews.title: A really nice hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: What could have been better: shower pressure was too low (probably Californian regs); no ethernet connection in room;
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I got the hotel through the Oracle convention and the rate was pretty good relatively. While I would not personally pay the going rate, I would recommend the hotel unreservedly.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife & I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon. The hotel is located right in the heart of the city which makes it a perfect base for going out exploring. Union Square is literally about 50 yards away and the cable car runs right past the front of the hotel with 2 cable car stops within a stones throw of the front door. Open top tour buses run from Union Square and the cable cars are the perfect way of travelling around the city and to the Fishermans Wharf area.
reviews.title: Customer service is excellent; perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I lived in San Francisco for 11 years (25 years ago). I miss three distinctive sounds of the city, the foghorns, the barking seals and the clanging of the cable cars. Over this past holiday season I spent 3 lovely nights at the Chancellor Hotel with friends. From the moment my wife and I arrived we were met by a friendly, attentive staff and our check-in was a breeze. Our room had a queen size bed with a choice of different pillows, a safe, a flat screen TV, wireless internet, a large walk-in closet, a nice bathroom with plenty of towels and toiletries including a rubber duck for your bath(Nice touch). The room was very quiet and comfortable and at night I could hear the sound of the clanging cable cars. I can't wait to return!
reviews.title: Great hotel on Union Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Chancellor for 3 nights in December 2008 and loved our time in the hotel! We booked through Trailfinders so don't have an exact idea of the cost of the stay, but it seemed great value for such a perfect location. We had a fab view of union square from our room on 14th floor - this was obviously within easy reach, as was fisherman's wharf (a long-ish walk, but plenty of public transport options) and all the main san francisco sights, shops and restaurants. plus a handy walgreens pharmacy and starbucks practically next door.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, great service, ideal location - loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we arrived at the hotel after a long trans-atlantic journey and unpleasant immigration experience and found the staff incredibly welcoming. Nate (we think) checked us in and we felt acknowledged and remembered by him throughout our stay, which was a lovely touch.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my husband had emailed the hotel in advance to advise we would be celebrating our first wedding anniversary there and we were very touched by the gifts waiting for us in our room. and being wished happy anniversary on check in and check out was a simple, yet lovely touch.
reviews.title: Simply the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: really don't want to mention any negatives because we really loved the hotel, but just as a little warning...you might have a while to wait for the elevator if you are lucky enough to get a room with a view at the top of the hotel!! not sure what the previous heating issues were all about because our room was lovely and cosy - we had the ceiling fan on most of the time! also loved the walk-in wardrobe/closet and properly sized bath (don't tend to find too many of those in the US!).
reviews.title: super little hotel in super spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights a few weeks ago. The location is great, right on Union Square. A bit of noise from the trams going past, but the sound of the bells being rung is part of SF. The room was fine, really liked the goose-down pillows and soft duvets. Didn’t try out the pillow menu, but a great idea as a pillow can make or break a good night’s sleep. The bathroom was okay, a bit in need of freshening up though. Scratches on the bath etc. overall a good stay, but nothing spectacular as I was expecting when I saw that it was rated 3rd in SF. I can’t comment on the service or food as we ate out all the time, but they were quite happy for us to check out at 6am due to a tour pick-up. Try the diner up the street. Real chrome and 50s kitsch. overall a nice hotel in a good location.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: Amazing hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel should be 4 or 5 stars for the service and the quality of the room, and proves how flawed the whole star system can be as I have stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels which have been much worse than this one.
reviews.title: Great location, funky room, good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly the location is second to none. You are staying right on union square in prime central location. You are staying right next to all the most expensive hotels, and the most expensive shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: To get there from the airport I would advise taking one of the shuttle buses which will cost only $14 plus tip, much cheaper than a taxi.
reviews.title: The Chancellor - A great little hotel
Great Location!
reviews.text: Check in was very efficient even though we arrived early the staff were very helpful and arranged for our luggage to be stored and for car parking for us.

reviews.title: My #1 in SFO !
reviews.text: The location was excellent - cable car right outside and with Sears opposite and Macy's down one block you couldn't ask for anything more!

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: The room was big enough with a large comfy bed and they have a selection of pillows available (e.g. anti snoring!) but the pillows which were already on the bed were fine.

reviews.title: Perfect stay
reviews.text: The bathroom was quite small but clean and all you needed.

reviews.title: The favorite of this frequent visitor
reviews.text: Our room was at the back so was quiet but I could imagine the front of the hotel could be a bit noisy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: Rooms - good size, spotless but a little dated
reviews.title: Excellent Value
AWESOME!!!!!! Just like the reviews said...
reviews.text: Location - at the center of everything

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: Service - very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Chancellor March 26-28. Arrived at about 11AM. Check-in was a breeze, even though we were early. We travel to SFO at least twice a year. We have stayed at several hotels in the area including the Westin St. Francis. For our money, we would choose the the Chancellor again for our next visit.
reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - Wow!
Wonderful Hotel -- Great Management Responses
reviews.text: The hotel is perfectly situated for everything a tourist would want to see and do in SFO. The cable car stops almost right upfront.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Chancellor for three nights and had a great experience. We stayed in a renovated room on the 8th floor overlooking Union Square. The room was small but comfortable, the new furnishings are great, the bed was comfortable and don’t forget the menu of pillows that are available for you... everything from a hypoallergenic, to a memory foam, to an organic something-other, to a snore-no-more type pillow (the isotonic is great). There is noise from Union Square, however the double-pane windows block 95% of the noise when closed. Everyone was friendly and helpful. We were able to purchase a Muni-pass in the lobby (a must-have when in S.F.), which was very convenient. Speaking of convenience, the cable car stop that is literally at the doorstep to the hotel is perfect. The Chancellor is so centrally located which makes it perfect for exploring the city. The area is nice. My wife and I both felt very safe. I don’t believe that there was any sort of continental breakfast, but there was coffee and cookies 24 hrs a day and a popcorn machine in the evenings.
reviews.title: Great experience at the Chancellor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will DEFINITELY stay here again.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Based on the reviews we read here on Trip Advisor we chose the Chancellor Hotel on Union Square for its location and the above average service. They lived up to all their reviews. The front desk staff, especially Rory and Mike, were outstanding. The hotel is an older property,well maintained and clean. The location is just great. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great starting point to a beautiful city

likes.liked: — value for money and friendliness of staff

reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at the Chancellor!
reviews.text: I booked this hotel through Trailfinders and after researching it on tripadvisor.com . Excellent location-just off Union Square-close to not only cable car stop but also Alamo car rental a 5 minute walk away. Chinatown in close proximity too.Small lobby but well staffed efficient reception and very informative trip service desk with adjoining small shopping kiosk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were fine-don't be put off by the fact there is no air-conditioning-the ceiling fans were fine.Also we expected it to be quite noisy at night-not at all-no problems. No coffee/tea makers in the rooms but in the lobby coffee and teas available around the clock-just help yourself and no charge. Also mouth watering cookies and muffins as well ! A jar of sweets-replenished daily-was also in our room. I musn't forget there is even a pillow menu-you can try different pillows to aid your sleep !
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights in two rooms over Christmas. Worked out really well for us. The bed was super comfy. The shower had plenty of hot water. The room was quiet for us. The room isn't large but has a couple of chairs and a desk. Free wireless internet too. San Francisco is one of those cities were if you are spending lots of time in your room, you just ain't doing the city right.
reviews.title: Great Value on Union Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 3rd floor room faced Powell street which is where the cable car runs and they start at 6:30am. This didn't bother us but we also don't sleep late. I'm guessing if you are a light sleeper who wants to sleep in you should ask for a room either higher up or not facing Powell. BTW, our 19 year old teenagers had no problem sleeping late! (Based on my other reviews I seem to be a little more sensitive to noise than others.)
reviews.title: Great value, great location!

likes.disliked: — Valet parking is pricey, but that's to be expected in San Francisco.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk was very helpful in recommending places to eat.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Only complaint (and the GM seems to read these comments) -- more chocolate chip cookies and fewer cinnamon raisin! Wow, that should be the complaint about all hotels right?
reviews.title: excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rented a car for a few days to go north along the coast. We self-parked which is no big hassle -- just around the block.
reviews.title: The Absolute Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed ay the Chancellor for 3 nights this week. We loved the historic charm of the hotel. Our room was very clean, had a HUGE walk in closet. The bathroom was small but it was fine. The bed was SO comfortable. We didnt take advantage of the "pillow menu" but it had some cool options. The hotel is right across from a cable car stop which was great. There are plenty of restaurants in the area and if you like to shop youre in heaven. We walked to Chinatown and down to North Beach. For breakfast we went right next door to Sears. I went here when I was about 6 and it looks the same. I highly recommend the oatmeal. Yes, the oatmeal. It was amazing. The husband had the "famous" pancakes but I honestly thought the waffle was much better. OK, back to the Chancellor. The staff at the desk was helpful with directions and gave us printed directions and a map to Golden Gate park. The park is out of the way but worth the visit. We spent the morning at the Japanese Tea garden and then walked to Haight Ashbury (overrated)
reviews.title: Location couldnt be better

likes.disliked: — thin walls, step going up to the bathroom (stubbed toes)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: The only bad thing I can say about the Chancellor was the walls were very thin. We heard the phone conversations and TV programs from the room next door. News, weather forecast, traffic, and stock woes all before 8am.
reviews.title: Fantastic!
Loved it!
reviews.text: Overall the location, price and service was great, the room was comfortable but not luxurious. I wouldnt recommend this hotel to elderly travelers because the walls of the tub are very high to step in and out of.

reviews.title: great staff & great location;would stay again!!!!!
reviews.text: My husband and I travel to San Francisco 2 or 3 times a year, and like to try out a new hotel each time. We prefer the Union Square area, but always face a conundrum: The smaller, renovated hotels are convenient, but often a bit rough around the edges. Of all the area hotels we've stayed in, the Chancellor Hotel comes closest to getting everything right. For starters, the location really is ideal. It's between Borders Books and the venerable Sears Fine Food, just steps off Union Square. The attractive lobby is open and airy, and the employees are impeccably helpful and polite. Our room, on an upper floor, was very tastefully decorated, with high-end bedding and contemporary appointments. The bathroom was squeaky clean, with modern fixtures and period details. Yes, the room was a bit on the small side, and the soundproofing could have been better. But those are the realities of an older hotel. It was ideal for us. I can definitely count our stay at the Chancellor Hotel as one of the best we've enjoyed in many years of travel to the City.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: Just returned from our 4th stay at the Chancellor. We wouldn't stay anywhere else. The staff are eager to help in any way possible and the location can't be beat. The rooms are small, but very clean. We ate breakfast in the restaurant 1 morning and enjoyed it very much. It is apparent that the General Manager cares, he was working the front desk at check out, not hidden in some office like General Managers of other hotels we have stayed in. Our only regret is that we will not be able to return until next January. We suggestg eating at Fior d'Italia if you are in the mood for Italian food. We love the Veal Parmigana.
reviews.title: Great location, nice friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for four nights. We had a mixed experience here, with some very positive things and some less good.
reviews.title: Positives and Negatives

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The positives: When we got to our room the hotel had given us two bottles of wine and chocolates to congratulate us, as it was our honeymoon. This was really appreciated and a lovely touch. The hotel has a fantastic location by Union Square and right on the cable car line, so it was very easy to get to all the tourist hotspots. We didn't eat here but we did have a drink in the bar, which was good and the staff were really friendly. There were no tea/coffee facilities in the room, but instead there was a constant supply of fresh coffee and cookies in the lobby, which was much nicer anyway. The activities desk were helpful, giving us good advice and helping us to sort out transport.
reviews.title: Returning to San Francisco & the Chancellor - we were not dissappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: Negatives: The reception staff were quite poor. Not especially friendly, and didn't give us the correct information when we checked in about computer access, so we ended up wasting money trying to access the internet in our room. When we asked for help with this the receptionist (the same one who had checked us in) treated us like we were stupid. The housekeeping routine was quite odd - we were given new towels everyday but the old ones were never removed, so by the time we left there was a large pile of these on the bathroom floor. We also noticed that some of the bedsheets had holes in them. The room was also quite dated, although we weren't sure whether this was deliberate and so we didn't mind it too much. There was also quite a lot of noise from both other guests and the street (though the latter is inevitable given the location).
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we feel that this could be a really nice place to stay with some small improvements in a few areas. We realise that our stay may have been atypical, and we had been staying in an exceptional hotel just before this so our judgement may have been slightly clouded.
reviews.title: Absolutely great!
Best location, very good breakfast, comfortable room
reviews.text: Having chosen to stay at the Chancellor some 3+ years ago, following Trip Advisor reports - we again were not disappointed. Simularly having a room on a higher floor - we had the window open, even though we had a front facing room, we did not suffer noise. The rooms are perfectly formed, although the step -up to the bathroom needs to be treated with care. Would I recommend it - well four other friends also visited!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for five days in May and was very impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms, the interior of the hotel, and the service we received. We choose offsite parking that is about a two minute walk around the corner to save some $$ which was not terribly bad as we only used our car twice during our stay. Regarding location, could have not been better. Hotel is about a six minute walk to Chinatown, 1/2 block from Union Square, and right on the main street for the Powell & Hyde cable car. Rooms were normal size, not too big or too small, bathrooms a little on the small side, and the water pressure in the shower was adequate enough for my taste. The only pet peeve I had while staying there was the air pressure in the hotel caused the main door in the room to rattle back and forth, but was easily remedied with a chair pushed up against it.
reviews.title: Great location and price
perfect place to be "bang in the midst of action"
reviews.text: fantastic location across the Union Square. Very friendly service at the hotel, especially at the bar. Alicia - God Bless you !. Though the rooms are small they are well provided with. And the pillows, as all reviewers say - yes.. that is a treat !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely stay on our next visit too. Would have appreciated having a water heater flask in the room though !.Shuttle service to the Airport and sightseeing facilities at the Hotel are commendable.
reviews.title: Great Value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: The rooms are small, but you simply cannot beat the location. Everything was clean and quiet. If you're planning on spending a lot of time in your room, then you might want to opt for something bigger, but when on vacation, chances are you won't be spending too much time at the hotel anyway. The Chancellor staff was great, breakfast downstairs was very good, and, while small, the rooms provided everything we needed.
reviews.title: Great location for conferences AND shopping!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Thank you Kevin (the manager) for accommodating my changing agenda.
reviews.title: Location location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having taken a long leisurely road trip from LA to San Francisco via Death Valley, Yosemite, Big Sur and the like, a few days in San Francisco staying at the Chancellor was the perfect end to a wonderful holiday. Everything about the hotel was excellent, the only downside was having to catch an early morning flight back home, but even at 6am the coffee and cookies in reception helped no end.
reviews.title: End of the line

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010
reviews.text: Hotel very comfortable & staff very professional and friendly! No air conditioning but fan in room, out the 7 nights, only felt hot & unfortable one night only! Bedding very comfortable, room big enough. Travelled with 2 others all stayed in separte rooms, two of the rooms had walk in wardrobe which was amazing. Location was fantastic with Union SQ right at your doorstep with transport at your reach if required. Will hope to stay there again when i return to San Francisco.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice hotel in a fabulous location in SFO. Bang next to the Union Square, this is a great place for a short stay in the city. Great kick off point for sightseeing as well as for some nice eating options. Rooms are unfortunately a tad too small but then you would just sleep over during a short stay. Breakfast at the hotel restauarant has some good options including some great Omlettes. A fabulous all American diner is also close by.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do plan for a 40 min ride to and from the airport.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights on our honeymoon. It was east to find only being a few blocks up from Powell Street BART station.
reviews.title: fabulous location, excellent staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I planned a suprise trip to San Fran and then Pheonix for my boyfriend. I chose Chancellor for price, location, reviews and the fact that the manager responds to negative reviews himself on this site. I figured that would reflect on the hotel staff. We loved the Chancellor! The room size was slightly small, but its SF and was fine for us. The bed was VERY comfy. The location was great because although we had a rental car, in the city it is just convienient to walk everywhere. We did valet for only a few dollars more a day, HIGHLY RECOMENDED. We didnt have to worry about getting our car in that crazy city! We would just call about 20 min early (when we were at breakfast) and our car would be waiting right out front. We went north to the Muir Woods, absolutely beutiful, highly recomended. And also traveled south to pebble beach for a round of golf. Bathroom amneties were nice, and we stole the rubber ducky from our room for a little souvenier. The only reason Im giving it four stars was because of the service our last day before leaving for the airport. Our car was brought to the front.. but the bell boy who had been very helpful when we arrived just watched as I dragged all our luggage (inluding a large golf bag carrier) to the rental car. I was expecting some help as a female! Unfortunate, but overall the hotel was a great place and I would stay again.
reviews.title: Great stay in SF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights over holidays while visiting our son in San Francisco. I requested a high view of Union Square and that is exactly what we got. The hotel is great, very quaint with a terrific staff. Yes it is old but that is part of the charm. It is kept in great shape and we had no problems whatsoever. We didn't hear any noise from the street.
reviews.title: Second stay as great as the first

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay in two years. Last time I requested a quiet room and we had a room at the back of the hotel. Quiet.
reviews.title: Fab location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location is great and we plan to come back often.
reviews.title: The wonderful experience at Chancelor Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the location of this hotel, if you are going to stay in San Fran, Union Square is the place to be, surrounded by shops and restaurants and right by the cable cars so very easy to get around.
reviews.title: Love the Chancellor Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a great location, friendly service, and above average accomodations, this is your place. It is located right off Union Square and convenient to everything downtown. The rooms are a little on the small side and a little dated. They are however, comfortable and clean. There are also a few extras, some at a small additional cost, that make things nicer such as foot baths, tempur-pedic type pillow, aroma therapy type items. The beds were comfortable. They have an arrangment with a fitness center a block away that allows you free visits. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. All in all, this was among the best values I've found in many trips to San Francisco. As long as you're not looking for 5-star luxury, I would highly recommend the Chancellor. One last thought, like everywhere in SF, the parking is expensive. Check out some of their package deals that include parking.
reviews.title: Great for what it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed through the weekend of 2/3 and this was my first time in San Francisco. The Chancellor Hotel was a great start to a San Francisco visit. The hotel is centrally located: the cable car, streetcars, buses, BART and muni subway are all close by so you can go to any part of San Francisco. It is in the middle of a nice shopping area: Saks, Macy's, Borders, See's Chocolates, Walgreens, Starbucks and great stores and restaurants on Market Street are all nearby or just blocks away. Union Square Park is across the street, so there's a nice place to just sit and catch your breath during the day.
reviews.title: Central Location in San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel itself is one of the older hotels so it has a lot of character and rooms have high ceilings. Although the hotel is older and rooms are smaller proportioned, the rooms are very prettily decorated and well-maintained and clean. All the staff people were very nice. A lovely touch was that coffee was available to the guests at the hotel at all times of the day. In the morning, the continental breakfast provided coffee, muffins and cookies. This hotel is all non-smoking, which is something that I really appreciated. The area around the hotel is pretty safe for a big city.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Amazing Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone; it's a pleasant place to stay, secure, clean, and centrally located.
reviews.title: Okay but could have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at The Chancellor Hotel for 7 days last week and could not have been more satisfied with my stay. The hotel is perfectly situated, well-maintained and very affordable given its superb location. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The extra touches (ex. cookies - those yummy cranberry ones!; rubber ducky in bathroom; pillow menu, etc.) are great too. I will be recommending this hotel to all my friends/colleagues who are planning trips to the Bay Area.
reviews.title: Perfect for SF getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: we were there the hottest weekend ever!!!! going there, we knew the hotel would be a small boutique hotel and would be w/o air conditioning. we didn't know how hot it would be tho. having said that, we were still comfortable enough when going to sleep. luckily, we had the quieter rooms in the back and were able to sleep with the windows open for fresh, cooler air. little city noise but didn't we mind that. we are after all in the heart of the city. our room didn't have a view but we were out all day so that didn't bother us at all. i love the fact that we were able to walk everywhere cuz trying to hail down a cab was not an easy task. bell guy, MATT, was able to hail a cab for us in front of the hotel, but to hail down a cab in the city was near to impossible. but with the central location of the hotel walking in any direction was safe and easy. the staff, from the front desk associates, to the bar tenders, to bell men, and to the nice lady at the tour desk, couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful.
reviews.title: small but comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the second time we have stayed at The Chancellor, the first being in 2006. The rooms have been refurbished since our last stay which is lovely but we were more than pleased to find the service and staff had not changed...they were as attentive, professional and as helpfull as ever. The Chancellor truly is the place to stay in SF. Best location, best price, best staff and best cookies! ....we will be back again!!
reviews.title: Second Time Around - Even Better!

likes.liked: — The location in unbeatable and the staff are incredibly helpfull.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After much deliberation and going through the reviews on TA we decided upon the Chancellor and glad to say we weren’t disappointed. We decided that the Union square area was more suited to us as there was only myself and girlfriend travelling. The Chancellor exceeded our expectations within 10 seconds of check in as we were upgraded for free to a suite, which had two full separate bathrooms, separate living room, fridge, and the all important tea and coffee making facilities. We had requested a room on a high floor with a nice view if possible our suite didn’t have a view so perhaps they we unable to give us a normal room with a view so they bumped us up to the suite? This was just my thinking anyhow and I’d have taken the suite over a view anyhow!! We have very little interaction with hotel staff in general unless we have a problem-we had no problems in the Chancellor so our interactions were limited although all the staff were warm and friendly from the cleaners to the front desk staff. We booked our wine country tour via the tour desk in the lobby and our return transport to the airport she was very helpful. With our upgrade I can’t offer insight into the normal rooms but the suite was probably decorated as the un-refurbished rooms from the website my girlfriend preferred the look of the older rooms anyhow. There isn’t really allot I can add from previous reviews-the location is excellent with plenty of dinning options and everything you’d need in and about Union Square. To me the only problems people seem to have with the Chancellor are caused by them not doing their research! The Chancellor is a charming well presented Boutique hotel with great service, it doesn’t pretend to be luxurious or fancy and their rates reflect this! It’s a shame that the Chancellor and San Francisco are on the other side of the world from us otherwise we’d return sooner rather than later! Great hotel that I wouldn’t hesitate recommending to anyone.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a great city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First stop on our whistle stop tour of the USA.
reviews.title: Great City to visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel late and not in the best of moods after a long flight from the UK and with all our luggage missing. The reception staff were very helpful and offered to look after our luggage during the night, should it arrive, and it did.
reviews.title: Perfect Chancellor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the hotel based on it's location and good reviews on tripadvisor. Its a nice hotel, great staff, I didn't know the hotel is 100 years old, but you can see it's a bit rough around the edges, the halls, and the elevators look like you've gone back in time. The bed was extremely comfortable and they had a list of body pillows you can request for free, which i thought was awesome! We were there in June when the weather was in the 80's and the room didn't have air conditioning only a ceiling fan which was uncomfortable for me because i need to sleep in the cold. I really liked Rory he checked us in as well as tended bar.
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: First time visitors from New Zealand, so hotel choice is confusing. We relied on tripadvisor feedback. An old hotel [circa 1915] and the rooms and bathrooms reflected that. That said, the location is great and the staff were obliging. What we really liked was the ground floor lobby. A friendly comfortable place with complimentary coffee, cookies, fruit and water. The adjoining bar was great for a relaxing drink after a busy day. So, if you are not too fussy about your room etc, then this is a good place stay.
reviews.title: An oldie but a goodie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel because of comments on this site. We were very pleased. Very central, helpful staff, and clean. OK the rooms are not huge, but who spends their vacation in their hotel room. More than adequate for a couple. Enjoyed happy hour!
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got this hotel through Hotwire with the "Secret Hot Rates" feature, so we didn't know anything about it before we booked and paid for it, but it worked out perfectly for us!
reviews.title: Perfectly good hotel, great location, reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the location is ideal for tourists. It's in Union Square, and within easy (downhill!) walking distance from the BART, the MUNI subway, and multiple bus lines (and even the free tourist trolley, should you choose to wait in a ridiculous line and ride that...) We love to walk, so we just walked everywhere unless we were short on time, but the Chancellor Hotel is perfectly situated for whatever neighborhood you want to visit. I've seen many other reviews complain that Union Square is plagued by homeless people, but really there's no escaping that in San Francisco. We felt safe the entire time, even walking around late at night.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at half past three in the afternoon to be told that the room was not ready, was not too put out as we had only came from Dallas, would not have been to happy if we had just gotten off a transatlantic flight. However soon forgot about the delay when we saw the room 1103. It was lovely with a great view of Union Square. Loads of room, great bathroom and huge closet. Lifts were great never had to wait long for them. Staff that we did speak to were pleasant and Susan at the tour desk was a great help. This hotel is brilliantly situated for everything and we will be rebooking when we return to San Francisco.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being on our honeymoon and having just left the Bellagio in Vegas and heading for a stay in the Chancellor in San Fran we were slighly anxious to say the least. We were anxious for nothing and did not need worry. On arrival we had a complimentary bottle of sparking wine and a lovely photo frame waiting in our room. Lovely touch. The room was a fine size, clean with a very comfortable bed. A great pillow menu available if thats your thing!! A nice touch also was the tasty sweet jar in each room which was filled each morning. If you like cookies and coffee well then this hotel is your paridise. They have complimentary coffee, tea and cookies available all day in the lobby. The only but..... is that they put the cookies up by the reception desk later in the evening and you feel guilty taking them!!! Well probably only because we were we savages......Should be ok for most people.
reviews.title: Excellent value
Good hotel, great location - poor breakfast.
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly, the location was prefect, tram outside your door, and good value shuttle service to airport available. To sum it up and given the price you pay for this hotel you could not ask for better value. I would consider myself being very critical of service and value for money but COULD NOT FAULT THIS HOTEL. Thumps Up for the Chancellor. Brendan Walshe & Amanda O'Shea, Cork, Ireland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: As the last reviewer said we also booked this hotel on the recommendation of many on TripAdvisor. We haven't been disappointed.
reviews.title: Loved it!
Fantastic Location
reviews.text: The location is superb, especially given the price. The cable car is right outside the door along with all the shops you could possible ever want. I've found the hotel staff friendly too and the wi-fi connection (which I'm using now) is a nice bonus (when it is working).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in September, and I was initially worried because there was no air conditioner. However, although it would have been nice, it wasn't as bad as I expected. The hotel was nice, the rooms were small, but it was close to everything and an amazing location. Very good hotel for the price.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel and close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights (Mon to Fri) in April. Lovely place to stay, staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are fine, some reviews say a bit small, but ours was just right, it had a couple of armchairs to sit in if the weather turns nasty and you need somewhere to sit and read and tuck in to the complimentary jar of candy. Added to this is the 24hr free coffee and cookies (and fruit on the front desk for the healthy) which they encourage you to take to your room. Try out the different pillows from the 'Pillow Menu'. The Tour desk in the lobby is great, same price as anywhere else for MUNI tickets for cable cars, trolley bus, bus. We were on the 9th floor, overlooking a corner of Union Square and there was no noise from the cable cars which run past the door on Powell Street. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights during first visit to San Francisco.On arrival at hotel all requests placed by travel agent at time at time of booking had been met, (high floor and frontal room location),also a nice touch of a complimentary bottle of champagne and birthday card.
reviews.title: Chancellor Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Complimentary tea,coffee and cookies available in the foyer 24 hours a day,room was very comfortable and of a good size.
reviews.title: Amazing Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is in an excellent central location for all the top shops and restaurants and right beside the cable car route,staff were friendly and helpful all together a good experience I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Why stay anywhere else?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: This was my 2nd stay at The Chancellor, and it was just as amazing as my first visit! It was my birthday weekend, and we were welcomed with a lovely bottle of wine in our room. The decor is so pretty, and the location is ideal for holiday shopping. So nice to recognize a few of the employees from 2 1/2 yrs ago. That shows to me that management treats their people right, and it shows in their treatment of their guests. I highly recommend The Chancellor to anyone wanting a romantic getaway hotel location!
reviews.title: Delightfully, charmingly,adorably perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked this cute hotel. Our room was "smallish", but spotless, featuring a very comfortable bed, plenty of pillows(hurray!), and enough room for two people to move around.
reviews.title: Swell time on our anniversary...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected this hotel online, mostly because it featured discounted parking and was right on Union Square. We don't regret our choice. The only downside for us was the spotty availability of hot water for tea in the lobby. We missed having a microwave or a coffeemaker in the room to make getting hot water more convenient.
reviews.title: Comfortable and well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights as part of our honeymoon and we were delighted to find chocolates, a present and a bottle of wine waiting for us when we checked in ! We had a room on one of the higher floors (17th perhaps ?) and we had a view of Union Square from the window.
reviews.title: Cozy in the city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is fantastic, with the cable car running to Fisherman's Wharf, just outside the hotel door and large department stores such as Maceys within five minutes walk. The bed was extremely comfortable and the decor and furniture in the room was tasteful. Some may think the rooms are on the small side, but maybe because we are from Europe and have different expectations we found the room size perfectly adequate.
reviews.title: Over rated hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate breakfast most mornings in the hotel restaurant and the service was good. The hotel offers some dicount vouchers for both the restaurant and bar when you check in. Suzy on the Tour Desk was extremely helpful and pleasant.
reviews.title: Wonderful View, Great Serivce, and Excellent Value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we really enjoyed our visit to San Francisco (see my review of green Dream Tours also) and we intend to visit again, but for a longer holiday. I will certainly book the Chancellor again.
reviews.title: One of my favorite hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I and our two teenage sons stayed at the Chancellor for 5 nights in August, 2007. We really enjoyed our stay and highly recommend the Chancellor to other travelers. Foremost, the hotel offers excellent value for the price in terms of its terrific location. We had connecting rooms on the 8th floor facing the front. While the rooms are not large, they are very comfortable and nicely furnished. The staff was consistently very helpful and the restaurant was great for breakfast. The hotel also offers nice extras like coffee and cookies in the lobby, free newspapers, free Wi-Fi access, and complimentary access to a health club a block away. The tour desk in the lobby is also very helpful. The only issue to keep in mind is that the hotel does not have air conditioning and keeping windows open at night could be a problem for light sleepers. We ended up closing our window overnight to cut down on the noise from the traffic below (the cable car goes right by the hotel).
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I just have to say that a lot of these reviews are bizarre! Checking in was easy and simple. I flew in with my friend and check in wasn't until later but they put a rush on the room. We went to grab breakfast and when we returned, the room was finished.
reviews.title: LOVED it ALL!
A Charming Hotel
reviews.text: The room had a great view of Union Square. The room was really beautiful and amazingly gorgeous. It was clean, everything was great. I can't even describe how wonderful it was. The furniture was amazing, dark and really great. The bathroom was somewhat small but it fit our needs. The closet was a large size and had a safe. The hotel gave options of spa amenities that we could use. They also gave the option of pillows from firm to softer and for legs, etc. It was much more than I expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: There is also a bar and a restaurant and a complimentary computer that you could use whenever.
reviews.title: Great experience and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The the two nights that we stayed there, it was comfortable and more than I really expected. It's near everything that we could have dreamed about. It's near the bars, shops, food, everything!
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for the perfect trip!

likes.liked: — It's location at Union Square, complete with Cable Car stop right out the front door.
likes.disliked: — Our view wasn't the best, but if we'd been just a few floors up I'm sure it would have been much better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: STAFF: Fabulous service from Kevin on reservations. Everyone we encountered was genuine, helpful & couldn’t do enough to help you out.
reviews.title: Highly recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CHECK IN: was seamless.
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOMS: quaint, compact and well appointed. Walk in wardrobe very practical.
reviews.title: The Chancellor is our home away from home & I wouldn't consider another place to stay in San Francisco!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: LOCATION: fabulous – right on cable car line, near shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: A great hotel to stay at right in the heart of Union Square.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: CABLECARS: we made great use of a 3day MUNI pass, clocking up 9x cablecar + 8bus + 3subway rides (not that I was counting).
reviews.title: Pretty good for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My 71 year old mother and I stayed at The Chancellor Hotel on Union Square June 4-7. I had read nearly every review listed on Trip Advisor, and I felt secure in my decision to book my room. I was not disappointed!
reviews.title: Charming, perfect, adorable hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our experience began with being greeted curbside by Matt, the Bell Captain. He was so nice, and helped us with our suitcases and shopping bags. Check in was quick and easy, and we were off to our room within minutes. I had previously requested a room away from street noise, based upon some of the reviews on Trip Advisor, and that was a great decision. Our room was on the back side of the hotel, and we heard very little noise.
