I also had requested a small refrigerator to be placed in our room, and within minutes of us arriving and settling into our room, the refrigerator was delivered without any problems. (And without a reminder about it!!) The parking garage the Chancellor uses is literally a block away, and even the fellows in the garage were very kind. Our room was adorable! The color scheme was up to date, with a vibrant kelly green and off white paint, with coordinating carpet and furniture. Our room was cozy, and was just perfect with two twin beds, perfect for my Mom and I. We had no issues whatsoever with not having air conditioning, as there was a fully functioning ceiling fan, and that combined with the open window allowed for adequate ventillation. (AND...it was in the 70's each day of our stay!!)
reviews.title: Excellent stay - a rare find in the heart of SF.

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, clean rooms, good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every member of the hotel staff was friendly, especially Matt, as previously mentioned, as well as Michael, who works at the gift /transportation counter. One evening, I even went down to see if someone could "cook" some microwave popcorn for us so we could watch one of the in room movies. Michael was happy to do so, and came back in two minutes with my bags of popcorn for me. He was very friendly and informative regarding the location of Chinatown, and the cable car system. It was such a nice feeling to walk into the hotel each day, and have someone recognize us each time we came out of the elevator. The day before we left, I asked about using a computer to print our boarding passes, and the gal at the front desk simply said she would take care of it for me. Within a few minutes, I had my boarding passes in hand. Finally, on our last day, another bellman helped us with our bags to the lobby. While I went to pick up the car, he was summoned elsewhere. Not to worry though, as Michael came from behind his counter, and helped us load up our bags into the car.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all, not only would I recommend this hotel to anyone who will listen based on how we were treated, but also because of the location! We couldn't have picked a better hotel! Everything we needed was within walking distance. We only drove our car from the airport to the hotel and back! The cable car line goes right in front of the hotel, which takes you right down to Fisherman's Wharf. Chinatown is about 3 1/2 blocks away, as is Macy's, and other wonderful shopping. We never did eat in the hotel restaurant, however, Sears Fine Foods next door was delightful, with their delicious Swedish Pancakes. Lori's diner was 1/2 a block away, and the convienence of having a Walgreen's just up the block made the microwave popcorn a reality.
reviews.title: good old fashioned service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I want Wes, the hotel manager to know what a great hotel he has, and he should take pride in knowing his staff is truly amazing. Each person loves their job, and I know I wouldn't get that feeling from the people at the "Big Name" hotels down the street. This really is a "Botique Hotel", and I couldn't even make up something poor to say about this hotel. Everything was great, and I honestly thank you for helping to be part of a wonderful memory, not just a place to stay.
reviews.title: Loved the Chancellor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read all the Tripadvisor reviews for the Chancellor Hotel, my wife and I booked 4 nights for our first ever stay in San Francisco. Having read many good things and being particularly impressed with General manager Wes Tyler's responses on this site, I am pleased to say that the hotel lived up to all our expectations. We had a friendly welcome upon check-in by Steve, the guy who dealt with us and the process was quick and very efficient. He also gave us a map and told us to come to reception with any queries. I had made a request to Kevin Vossen prior to travel for one of their reburbished rooms on a high floor with a good view of Union Square and they were able to fulfil this request so thanks very much Kevin!! Brilliant view of Union Square day and night and the windows did a great job of blocking the noise out. The room was nicely decorated and clean. It was more than big enough for our needs and the bed was very comfy! Bathroom was clean and maybe a little small for some but we were happy with it. Having complimentary coffee and tea available (along with the cookies) is a really great idea and gives the guests so much freedom and free use of their computer for internet access is an added bonus. One of the best things about the hotel must be it's location to Union Square, the San Francisco centre and everything else. It's fantastic! We could spend all day sight seeing and then spend the evening shopping with it being so easily accessible! Union Square is also close to all the main transportation routes so is ideal as a base. We were originally going to stay on Fisherman's Wharf but upon visiting it are very glad that we didn't. Too touristy for our liking and a bit further out. Our recommendation is stay around the Union Square area, you won't regret it! So, to get back to it, we throughly enjoyed our trip to San Francisco and our stay at the Chancellor Hotel. San Francisco as a city is really great and our stay was made all the more better with us staying at the Chancellor Hotel. Well done Wes and co. keep up the good work! We may not be heading back to SF for a while yet but we hope that when we next return, the hotel will still be keeping up it's high standards and we'll be staying there once again! One last thing! A nice and thoughtful touch is to have an umbrella in the room closet for us to use - came in handy on our last full day when it absolutely rained all day!!!
reviews.title: Great hotel in superb location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First let me tell you that I spent a great deal of time reviewing hotel after hotel in Union Square before deciding on the Chancellor. I wanted this to be a picture perfect trip with my picture perfect girlfriend who had never visted the city. I could not have been more happy. The manager was wonderful, the staff friendly and helpful, and the location as perfect as you could get. The room was very clean, the extra little things done by the staff (ducky in bathtub, champange in room, frame as gift, pillow menu) made this the nicest hotel I have stayed in in San Francisco. I advise anyone to wants to stay in a clean hotel with a perfect location to stay here. And hey...those bathtubs are HUGE!! I LOVED IT!
reviews.title: Loved it, loved it, loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007
reviews.text: I have to tell you I was amazed at very few negative reviews that I read and their comments. "Was noisy"? Ummm maybe you need to stay in Ohio....see this is a city, and a city it well noisy, thats the glory of it all! Besides (and i stayed on the Union Square Side) with the windows closed I could not hear a thing.Or (this one was my favorite) "Not enough TV stations", let me tell you if you are coming to San Francisco and watching TV, you DEFFF need to not leave Ohio. (And I apologize for those people from Ohio who dont complain about these type of things).
reviews.title: The perfect City Hotel
Great Little Hotel
reviews.text: All in all, I dont think i would have traded in my room at the Chancelor for a room at the Sir Francis Drake next door (and to boot I saved a few hundred dollars a night). Thanks, and we will see you again next year. Also for the travellers who dont want to rent a car, great place to stay as well. Took the BART from the Airport to the Powell Street Stations, got on a trolly and got off 10 feet from the hotel. All for 10 bucks in transport costs. Enjoy SF and enjoy the Chancellor. And staff, Keep up the good work!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Frank
reviews.title: Experience the charm!
Wonderful Stay at the Chancellor
reviews.text: Just got back from our California coastal trip starting in San Francisco at the Chancellor. I chose our 4 different hotels, including the Chancellor, after reading great reviews consistently on all on Trip Advisor. The Chancellor was everything and more that we thought it would be - very clean, centrally located, with very friendly and helpful staff. After reading reviews on Trip Advisor, we knew the rooms were smallish, that there was no a/c, and that the hotel was an older boutique style establishment, none of which negatively impacted our stay in any way. I would recommend the Chancellor to everyone.

reviews.title: Oldie But Goodie
reviews.text: I have to echo the many other favorable comments about service and value. If you are staying in SF and need access to the business district this is the one. (I travel worldwide and stay in many expensive five star hotels.)

reviews.title: You did it again, Wes!!!
reviews.text: My colleague needed a razor after the hours of the small hotel gift store and the clerk immediately sent out for one and it was brought to his room.

reviews.title: Very Satisfied
reviews.text: Although the clerks were not too knowledgeable when I asked about restaurants with specific cuisines both clerks offered to help with one handing me a Zagat book and the other looking up information on the computer.

reviews.title: Excellent base for all our needs
reviews.text: The waitress at the breakfast restaurant anticipated my needs perfectly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from staying three nights at the Chancellor Hotel and have to say that all the Trip Advisor reviews were right on the money. We enjoyed the above-par service, the clean and cozy room (yes, a little tight but workable), the coffee and cookies in the lobby 24/7, and cozy bar where we could enjoy a cocktail in a quiet atmosphere -- all at a very reasonable price. Best of all, the hotel is totally non smoking!! Location is perfect, right near Union Square and in front of a cable car stop, within walking distance of many fine resturaunts and shopping areas. Kudos to the Chancellor for making our stay in San Francisco most enjoyable!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location -- and a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We have just returned from 4 nights at the Chancellor Hotel, Union Square, San Francisco.
reviews.title: Can reccomend the Chancellor Hotel in San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Whilst appearing to be quite a modest hotel compared to the looks of some of the others, we were impressed with the helpful staff and the superb location.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were immediatey made to feel welcome, and although the room was smallish, we had everything needed for our stay.
reviews.title: location, location, location only the beginning, beginning, beginning

likes.disliked: — Can't think of a thing I did not like about this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 5 nights during Christmas week at the Chancellor. Staff, location, decor, comfort, value were all perfect. Our only complaint is that we purchased a package with a $25 per day "dining" credit that we planned to use for breakfast, but we could not use it on 2 of our 5 days because the dining room was closed on Christmas day (with no notice to guests) and was "open" but unstaffed from 7:00 to 7:15 in the morning the day before when we needed to have breakfast. So we had an unspent balance of $36 at the end of our stay. When I mentioned this problem at checkout, I was given a credit of $10, which to me seemed an inadequate response; I expected at least the $25 for the day the dining room was closed. I also mentioned this problem on my hotel comment card, but I've heard nothing back, so I assume there will be no further attempt by management to do better. Too bad. Nevertheless, we will certainly go back to the Chancellor; it is a great independent hotel.
reviews.title: nearly perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well its been said many a time but the location of this hotel makes it a winner, and the price is fab but its all the extra touches that give it an addtional edge the pillow menu, sweetie jar in room, umbrella to use (we didn´t need luckily!, free cookies, tea and coffee in lobby, they also laid on addtional breakfast items xmas day as the restaurant was closed, helpful friendly staff also contibute greatly to the winning package.
reviews.title: Its all in the details

likes.disliked: — Noisy service room near our bedroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If i had to be picky ( i work in the travel industry for a tour operator and part of my job is checking over properties before people arrive) the t.v reception was poor and the internet did not work in the room also i would have liked a fridge in the room. Our room was comfortable and warm with a great view of union square but i heard some guests were cold in the non south facing rooms. So i´d suggest requesting one when you book. We had some kind of storage cupboard next to our room too which was noisy early in morning with staff banging about
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

likes.disliked: — No bar scene, restaurant no open for dinner.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: These are minor things however and i would definately return and highly recommend to others

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: San Francisco is a great city and this is a wonderful base
reviews.title: Best value in SF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here over New Year's Eve and we were throughly satisfied. The room, although small when compared to most modern hotels, was very clean and very quaint. We were on the top floor with a nice view of Union Square. Note - If you don't care for traffic noise you may want a room not facing the street. The staff was very friendly and helpful and since it was New Year's Eve they had extra security measures to prevent "unwanted" guests into the hotel.
reviews.title: New Years In SF

likes.liked: — Location and cleanliness of the room
likes.disliked: — High traffic area and lots of pan-handlers in Union Square area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is EXCELLENT. If you are into shopping, Union Square is surrounded by big retail stores. Food-wise, we couldn't pass up Sears Fine Food (next door to the hotel) home of the "little pancakes". Note - get there early (before 8am), when we left there was a line out the door! We also had dinner across the street at Scala's Bistro. It was very busy so instead of waiting 30-40min we took a seat at the bar and had dinner there. The bartenders were nice and the food was good but nothing to write home (or TripAdvisor) about.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is right on the street car line which is awesome! You can make it to most of the major tourist spots on this system. Also, the hotel is a few blocks away from the Powell street BART station which is great if you are flying in and not planning to rent a car.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All-in-all, I would definately recommend this place and I would stay here again.
reviews.title: The Only Place I Will Stay Fram Now On!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights in late april 06, highly recommended, helpful staff, clean, great location. No problems with temperature at all.
reviews.title: Value for money in SF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights in January 2008.
reviews.title: Great location, good value
cozy accomodations, helpful staff
reviews.text: I had a "renovated queen room" on the 4th floor for $100 a night. Location-wise, the hotel is a few steps from Union Square, so perfect for shopping and dining, which was why I chose to stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impression of the hotel isn't great - hopefully they plan to renovate the lobby and elevators soon. You also have to initial about 6 different clauses when you check in, whereas with most hotels a signature and a credit card suffices. This is a petty point, but the hotel logo is also outdated and needs to be something more modern, to go with the renovations.
reviews.title: Wonderful Location but Basic Hotel

likes.disliked: — The staff were a bit unfriendly and the rooms were very basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was great. The renovation meant the room had a modern lick of paint and new modern bedroom furniture...the green was a good choice. I slept well in the bed and could have chosen from a list of 10-12 special pillows to order to my room. There was a large walk-in wardrobe/closet which made up for the size of the room, a little on the small size, and an in-room safe, which was appreciated. The bathroom looked like it hadn't been renovated for 10-20 years but was clean and I appreciated having a "proper" bath tub, which for the non-Americans means a tub you can bathe in up to your shoulders. Much appreciated after a long flight!
reviews.title: Great location

likes.liked: — Location and large, extremely comfortable bed
likes.disliked: — Bar too small to be relaxing, but still priced well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With the current exchange rate, this was a very good deal for a hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: Perfect end to our Honeymoon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located in the center of the San Francisco shopping district. For the location we expected this room to be priced higher. The room was spotless, modern décor, comfortable bed and courteous staff. We definitely recommend this hotel. Five star hotel for a three star price!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked all of our hotels based on TripAdvisor reviews and this one was the best! The Chancellor is in a perfect location (unless you want to avoid shopping which is plentiful here) for all San Fran travel. Tons of food nearby, starbucks across the street if that's your thing.
reviews.title: Great Place - what a value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were great - saved us a place to unload, gave great directions to avoid horrible uphill climbs and were generally really pleasant. The cookies, always available tea/coffee and candy were a nice bonus.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are smaller than some - but we don't spend much time in a room when we travel. The beds are super comfy and the room is well decorated. Water pressure and temp were good - often hit or miss in larger hotels.
reviews.title: For the birds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So glad we stayed here and will definately return.
reviews.title: Chancellor is a great find - but not for everyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My second visit to San Francisco and still like it. We picked this hotel because of the good reviews here and its very reasonable price. Cable car is at the doorstep and there are numerous great restaurants and shopping outlets nearby. We did not eat at the Hotel, though the menu looked good. Instead we have had breakfast twice at Boudin 5-minute walk down the street at Macy's and dinner at Sears Fine Food next door. Both are absolutely fantastic.
reviews.title: Perfect location, Small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel room is really small, though very clean and comfortable. We were given a room on the low floor (3rd or 4th) but we could not hear anything from the street (with windows opened). The bathroom is tiny and what came out from the shower head were nothing more than water powders. You certainly need patience, esp if you have long hair. Pretty understandable though for old buildings.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free in-room WiFi was great.
reviews.title: would stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For its price and convenience I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Old style charm with modern comforts and ammenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on TripAdvisor reviews, choosing the Chancellor was a no-brainer. So I did, easily, on-line. In the meantime, a relative who visited SF 30 years ago had great memories of a hotel and went to check out which it was. You guessed it - this one. I'm sure a lot has changed since. Including the rubber duckie, which now carries an I-pad and cell phone. But a lot hasn't changed - it's clean, friendly, efficient and well-run.
reviews.title: Chancellor Hotel in a great location! Rooms are very small especially bathroom.
Excellant Location, Excellant VFM - Staff great!
reviews.text: Fantastic location - on Powell - so next to the tram, easy to get about - main buses and streetcars at the bottom of the road. Close to the shops and Chinatown. Excellant value for money. Rooms were clean and tidy and had everything you could need - iron, safe, umbrellas, rubber duck - seriously.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only downside - didn't think much of the restaurant - but who eats in a hotel when you are somewhere like SF?!
reviews.title: Does what is says on the tin
What a great location and a nice hotel!
reviews.text: My partner unfortunatly contracted food poisoning (from the restarant opposite, Scala) on the last night - the concierge was fantastic on calling out a doctor etc and were patient whilst I had to run around arranging flights etc and allowed us to stay in the hotel extra late. Unfortunatly the hotel was full so could not stay and extra night, but they arranged a room at the Cartwright round the corner - and the bellboy pushed our stuff up there - so excellant customer service.

reviews.title: Chancellor: Amazing Hotel, Beautiful Suite, Perfect Location
reviews.text: The Valet parking was cool too (if a little dear - like $50)

reviews.title: Loved it
reviews.text: Check out the Gold Dust lounge for a drink - down the road - the band in there played all the ol' faves and had a nice friendly atmosphere

reviews.title: Great location - the hotel "does what it says on the tin!"
reviews.text: First class location in heart of San Francisco. Rooms adequate in size but certainly not large. Standards of cleanliness were OK. Staff friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I just returned from a five-night stay at the Chancellor and found it absolutely perfect. I am astonished at the review that said she had a horrible bed - we had one of the BEST beds we've ever slept in at a hotel. The location is perfect for access to Union Square, the BART, the cable cars, and there are lots of wonderful restaurants in the area. The entire staff was very helpful, remembering us by name, and doing everything they could to be of assistance (making dinner reservations, looking up BART departure times, getting us a cab, etc.). They provided a mini fridge to our room upon request too.
reviews.title: Best Value and Top Hotel in San Francisco!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: Some may comment on the smallish room and bathroom, but we found it to be more than adequate - and about the size of nice hotels in Europe. If you want to pay extra to say in a suite, fine - go for it. We didn't need air conditioning in November and found the overhead ceiling fan and open windows more than adequate. And our room (909) was incredibly quiet. NO street noise other than the occasional cable car.
reviews.title: Smiles all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from spending our entire vacation week at the Chancellor. Yes, when we first walked into the room, it seemed small. But of course I've read everything on tripadvisor and we expected that. It would have been small, had we brought kids with us and tried to put a cot in there. But for the two of us, who used the room for a late-afternoon rest each day and then for sleeping each night, it was just perfect. The walk-in closet and drawer space meant we could truly unpack and get rid of our suitcases. The bathroom had plenty of shelving and great supplies. The tub was big enough for 2 to soak in. Plenty of hot water, and everything in the room and bathroom was very clean and pleasant.
reviews.title: We shall return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, offering good suggestions when we asked about restaurants and showing us exactly which buses would take us where. In a week, we never had to take a cab, and we explored every neighborhood in the city.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had specifically asked for a high floor, overlooking Union Square, and that is exactly what we got. We were blessed with warm, beautiful weather all week and had our room and bathroom windows open a few inches the entire time. There is also an overhead fan to help cool the room down when the sun streams in. The two elevators are new, very quiet, very fast...just excellent. We never heard a peep from our neighbors. If street noises bother you, just bring some of those little foam earplugs. Or walk a few steps up the block and get some at Walgreens.
reviews.title: Loved the Chancellor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: There are complimentary copies of the SF Chronicle, NYTimes and USA Today in the lobby each morning. Excellent coffee and tea, and always some cookies and fruit there for the taking at all times. Freshly popped popcorn many afternoons. Problem-free wi-fi in the rooms or in the lobby, free local phone calls...all these "little" things added to the comfort and economy of our visit.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006
reviews.text: The best restaurants are NOT in Union Square, but half the fun of being there is venturing out to other areas and finding new favorites. We found the absolute best breakfast in San Francisco several blocks away. The hotel's breakfast is very tasty too.
reviews.title: A True Gem in the Heart of San Fran
The best!
reviews.text: Not allot to add that hasn’t already been said on the Chancellor that hasn’t already been said before.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Chancellor first back in 2008 in a suite (complementary upgrade) so when we were coming back at the end of September we looked again but the rates were a little over budget as we were spending a total of 3 weeks touring California. The General Manager offered me the same rate I could get a much lower rated hotel so of course I took his hand off!
reviews.title: Appalling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And that about sums the Chancellor up really, they’ll bend over backwards for their patrons. It’s obviously not just for return customers either as the first time we were given the suite after we couldn’t get a standard room with a requested ‘good view’.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This time around we got room 1500 on the top floor, a standard room with a killer view of Union Square. I was glad to get a standard room as I’m aware most of the Chancellors negative reviews relate to small rooms? By European standards I’d say it was above average in size, loved the décor and the bed was really comfortable. We arrived to the surprise of a bottle of wine and a gift in the form of a photo frame-nice touch. Can safely say that the weather was unseasonably warm when we arrived (three figures at times) and we never felt hot despite the lack of air conditioning.
reviews.title: Great hotel - fabulous location!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did want to try and meet Wes on this visit and commend him on the good work he and his team do but unfortunately never got the opportunity. But I’m sure he’ll read this as he seems to have his finger on the pulse of his customers.
reviews.title: I Can't Find Anything To Moan About!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently had a 2-night stay at the Chancellor as part of a long weekend. This hotel is a serious bargain, located just off Union Square and near tons of restaurants and shops. The rooms weren't huge but they were certainly big enough, and the hotel was clean and pleasant. I didn't love the restaurant for breakfast, but head up the block to Lori's diner for a better one. Chancellor is well worth the money.
reviews.title: Great location, great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in The Chancellor in San Francisco as part of our Honeymoon in the USA. When we arrived in our room (lovely, comfortable and spacious) the hotel had left us a bottle of bubbly and a gift of a picture frame - we thought this was a lovely touch - esp as none of our other hotels had done anything like that or acknowledged we were on our honeymoon. The location is perfect - right next to a cable car stop and the atmosphere around Union Square in the evenings is great. The bellboy and bar man in particular were so helpful and friendly. could have stayed chatting all night! The hotel also provides tea, coffee in the lobby area (though unfortunately we only found out about it on our last night ) and even popcorn on the Saturday night. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone - its in a nice busy & atmospheric part of San Francisco but is still quiet and peaceful inside.
reviews.title: Great location & Lovely Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location, on Union Square, is ideal. What's more, the twin-bedded room was spacious and well-appointed. The staff, from desk clerk to barman (and woman) to housekeeper were courteous and helpful. The endless supply of tea, coffee, cookies, and apples in the lobby was a treat. And the rate was most economical for the quality of service we received.
reviews.title: Location location location and more!

likes.disliked: — There was nothing we did not like

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here for our honeymoon and were so pleasantly surprised. It started with our welcome gift of champagne, glasses and a wooden picture frame. The location is safe and seriously right by the cable car stop. The hotel is also close to great restaurants like Sears (breakfast) and Uncle Vito's (Lunch/Dinner).
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is respectful of privacy. We left the "Do Not Disturb" sign out while we were gone for the day to skip the room cleaning. We came back to a polite note under our door saying that they acknowledged our sign but would be happy to bring us fresh towels if we would like.
reviews.title: a classy gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, fantastic location and brilliant staff. What more could you ask for?!
reviews.title: Fantastic
Small But Beautiful
reviews.text: I have stayed in a few hotels in San Francisco and this is easily the best value. Just off Union Square, it’s perfect for shopping and sight-seeing.

reviews.title: Europoean Style Hotel
reviews.text: I would thoroughly recommend the hotel to all travellers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Chancellor Hotel last month and was delighted with the service and accommodation. The rooms, although smaller than the usual American standard, were perfectly adequate and comfortable. The staff were extremely helpful and the extras provided made our stay at The Chancellor very memorable. The coffee & cookies, on tap 24/7, is a great boost, along with the apples and popcorn. I would certainly recommend this hotel, in fact I have been doing so back at work and to my friends. If I go back to San Francisco I will certainly be staying at The Chancellor.
reviews.title: Best Place I have Stayed
Chancellor hotel a great stay
reviews.text: I have used Tripadvisor extensively for the past few years. I decided to give the Chancellor Hotel a try due to it's reviews. Hotels as a whole are expensive in San Francisco & this one seemed to be a bit more moderately priced. My expectations were not high but my hopes were. As we entered the lobby my heart sank as it is drab, dreary & dull! We continued up to our room in one of the tiny elevators. Following the narrow hallway to our room, it made me think of historical hotels we've stayed in in NYC & Europe. We were pleasantly surprised when we entered our room! Although the room was very small (no room for a roll away), it was tastefully decorated. It's bedding was excellent. It had 4 pillows (you can request a variety of options), a fiberfill mattress topper, as well as 2 duvets with excellent linens. The carpet was newish with a tasteful plaid. The windows had sheers plus black out drapes which allowed sleeping in. Ours looked out on Powell & since we were on the third floor, when the window was open, it was very noisy. However, when closed it was very quiet & did not cause us any problem. ( They should do commercials for the effectiveness of their windows.) You would not be able to sleep with it open due to the noise, however. The hotel is not air conditioned but a ceiling fan was very efficient & served our needs. The bathroom is so tiny two people can't be in it at the same time, unless one wants to stand in the bathtub. However, it has a nice makeup mirror, good shower head, & plenty of lighting. In the room we appreciated & took advantage of the suitcase stands & safe & ice machine down the hall. In the lobby we enjoyed the gratis coffee, cookies, apples & newspapers provided. All the staff we met were pleasant & accommodating. We were very impressed with Susan who books tours, etc, as she seems to work at least 12 hour days in little more than a closet. Other than the lifeless lobby, the hotel is lovely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My young adult son and I stayed here for one night at the end of my birthday weekend, early February. Though a bit more expensive than deals at other boutique hotels in Union Square, the very positive reviews and ratings intrigued me and made me curious. The Chancellor's friendly, helpful staff, cozy charm, and clean old fashioned rooms were perfect. Watched the Super Bowl at the cute hotel bar, with elegant Irish bartender and other guests (all men except for me). Late dinner delivered, free of charge, from a nearby restaurant. Perfect stay!
reviews.title: Great, well maintained old fashioned charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: So glad I chose the Chancellor, and look forward to staying there again.
reviews.title: Cozy hotel, ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Somewhat accidentally found this hotel after searching my "regular" hotel on Union Square bumped their prices from my previous stay there. A quick search on tripadvisor yielded this superb, economical find.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Superb Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are small, reflective of an "older hotel," but well-appointed. The staff is extremely friendly and willing to assist as best they can--they even offer day/multi-day passes for the cable car/streetcar/bus lines which offers a tremendous value to travelers.
reviews.title: A quiet sanctuary off of busy Union Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be aware, though, if you're looking for a late night bite, or a cocktail, the bar and smallish restaurant close early (around 9:30). But there are plenty of other walkable nearby options if the mood strikes you there. The "business center" such as it is, consists of a computer on a desk next to the reception desk. But it served my basic functional needs.
reviews.title: Fantastic location - perfect for the first time and repeat visitor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I rate this hotel average only because the rooms were a little on the old side and had
reviews.title: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION with a GOOD PRICE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: that old smell to it. Kinda of a personal thing.
reviews.title: Perfect for short stay in San Fran

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The bathroom was nice and clean but the bed was the best part of the room really very nice, we slept like a baby.The location was fantastic right at Union Square with all the shopping at a very very good price. We checked out the others and this was half the price at or around Union Square.The service was very good, the girls at the front dest were delightfull and very helpfull.
reviews.title: Location and price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel restaurant you might want to pass on. Parking is avalible for hotel right around the corner at a price but its fare.
reviews.title: Great place, great treatment!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: In terms of location, the Chancellor hotel couldn't get any better - (a) just a few minutes walk from the Powell St. BART station (which goes to / from the airport), (b) on union square so very near Westfield Shopping centre and also a nice enough area and (c) on the Fisherman's Wharfcable car route. It's also near a lot of the car rental companies.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the chancellor at the end of our roundtrip through california, arizona and utah. It was a really nice hotel with very friendly personel, who where ready to answer all of our questions at any time and gave us great tips on where to go and eat. Nice clean room. The lokation is great, central in the city on union square, from were you can get almost everywhere.
reviews.title: good hotel, nice lokation and very friendly personell!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The only thing we regret is the poor shuttle service, which we were shown at when we asked tot call for a cab to the airport. We were cramped in to small fan with 7!! persons, when we complained the driver just ignored us and said that it was'nt his responsibility.
reviews.title: Value but thin walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the only negative thing we experienced at our stay.
reviews.title: Exceeded our Expectations

likes.disliked: — Loud toilet, unable to control room temperature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would like to recommend this hotel very much.......but don't use the shuttle service!
reviews.title: A great value in San Francisco
Don't Stay Here!
reviews.text: The Chancellor actually gets 5 on service/value & 2.5 on ambience. I got $100/night via Expedia-great rate for downtown SF on Union Square for an older but upgraded facility that had free and reliable wireless internet, free access to a health club 1 block away, free paper, coffee, cookies, immaculate, & excellent customer service. Comfortable bed but room small, dark, somewhat depressing, mournful-green decor. Real problem-thin walls. In my first room, my neighbor came in at 3 AM, loud conversation, easily heard, awful night. Not the hotel’s fault though they were more than gracious in getting me a room on the top floor, away from cable car noise, & with much better light. Also retrieved a couple of things I forgot in the course of the move. Could still hear conversation next door but not at all hours of night, an improvement. Bottom line-excellent value if you are a deep sleeper.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the Chancellor Hotel on Trip Advisor - and were very happy we did.
reviews.title: I have recommended The Chancellor to friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is excellent – great shopping and dining all around the hotel. The BART, cable car, and street car are all within 3 blocks (do not rent a car - buy the MUNI pass).
reviews.title: Best Location, best place to stay and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are small but very clean and nice - awesome bed and pillow menu.
reviews.title: "Amazing!! From Liverpool with Love!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The staff could not have been any nicer – from the front desk to housekeeping.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel wih great services

likes.liked: — great services; free internet connection; next to activities in the area
likes.disliked: — No Air-conditioning; not enough plugs for electrical traveling stuff; furniture is too cluttered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: All this being said – it must be the best value in San Francisco as the room rates were at or below most in the area. If we visit San Fran again, we will stay here again.
reviews.title: Good value hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel is located near various transportation options. It was perfect for hoping on and off the cable car. We had a room overlooking Powell St., it was a little noisy but exactly what we had expected. If you must have it absolutely quiet to sleep don't stay on that side of the hotel. We enjoyed listening to the city below. Room was clean, small (but large enough for the 2 of us), nicely decorated. Staff was friendly. Would definitely stay here again!!
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: My 3rd stay here and it is a perfect fit. Stayed for 5 nights and this time was placed at the front of the hotel which I thought would be noisy. However once window closed there was only the faint noise of the cable car which if you on union square is a lovely sound. I like that you are in the centre of everything and able to use transit to get to all areas of the city and then be able to return to your cosy room at the end of the day. For a solo traveller the rooms are roomy and as stated the closet is very large. The bathroom is small and adequate and has lovely green tea bath products. Pillows and bed is very comfy and as stated the hotel is historical so the hallways are a little tight . Staff are very friendly and will store your luggage if you have a later flight so you can explore more. Free access to printer and internet in lobby. Had breakfast in restaurant one morning and was scrumptious. I was contemplating trying a different hotel on this visit. I am glad I didnt!!!
reviews.title: It Is A Treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This isn't the first time I have stayed at the Chancellor and I'm certain it will not be the last.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay
Great Location
reviews.text: Great location-right in Union square. Reasonable pricing. Staff was helpful. MUST DO --- eat @ Tommaso's in North Beach for good Italian

reviews.title: Fantastic first stop on our trip
reviews.text: This was our first hotel on our trip to the USA. It was in a fantastic location right on Union Square, with a cable car stop to Fisherman's Wharf etc right across the street, and within walking distance of Chinatown.

reviews.title: Great location on Union Square. Cozy Room
reviews.text: The staff were welcoming, very friendly and genuinely helpful (recommended restaurants, provided directions and bus advice).

reviews.title: Ambassadors for San Francisco and America……
reviews.text: The room, although it didn't have a view of Union Square, was quiet (considering its location), clean and airy. The room service was excellent, with plenty of clean towels and fresh linen, not to mention the little extras like the jar of sweets (no charge), choice from a menu of pillows (no charge) and being able to order a foot spa in the room after a long day walking round the city ($4 for 24 hrs) - very welcome!

reviews.title: Hotel with Character
reviews.text: The breakfast in the hotel was fairly expensive, but the service and food was good. It's not a problem since there are dozens of places to eat within a few minutes walk (especially next door!)

reviews.title: Clean & great location--plus wonderful apples, cookies, coffee
reviews.text: We stayed here 3 nights in February and really enoyed our stay. It's on the cable car line and right at Union Square where you can shop, take an on-and-off bus, etc. We loved the apples at the front desk and the coffee (or hot water for tea) and cookies near the elevator. OK, our room wasn't very big (although we had the biggest bathtub I've ever seen), but it was big enough and very clean. It had a huge closet where we kept the things that might normally have been kept out in the room. And though we had sunny days the whole time we were in SF, we were delighted to know that an umbrella was in the closet for use if needed. I'm not sure about this, but I think I read that this hotel is not air-conditioned, so you might want to check on that if you are staying in the summer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on the third floor, and I like to take the stairs whenever possible. The stair well is narrow and a bit twisty--an interesting reminder from this historic hotel that people weren't always the super-size we often are now. Anyway, because I used the stairs, I discovered a tiny wall-niche take-one, leave-one library (on the second floor, I think). Anyway, although I didn't end up getting a book, it was fun to look at all of the books in languages I don't read, certainly a commentary on the kind of international clientele served by the Chancellor Hotel. We would very definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel and perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent the last week at the Chancellor. What a great place! We had originally booked the Donatello but switched last minute due to the bad noise reviews, we are so glad we did. From the time we booked over the phone till the day we left, everyone is very nice and helpful! Be sure to buy your Muni pass from the tour desk, very convenient!! The room was always very clean. Yes it is a bit small, but who spends time in the room anyway?! We were on the 8th floor and noise was really not an issue. We would close the window at night and could barely hear the street cars and noises. Loved the location right next to Union Square, easy to find places to eat and transportation. Had a good time at the tiny bar one night, we just wish it was open later. Highly recommend this hotel even for a longer stay!
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in June 2011, really great location right in the heart of SF. Rooms were ideal, clean and average size. Great base to explore SF from! We drove a hire car from the airport and had to park a few blocks away in a secure carpark for a charge, was slightly inconvienient but you can't really expect more in such a big, busy city! Would definately recommend to other travellers!
reviews.title: Favorite place to stay in SF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love this place. Best possible location, 1/2 block off Union Square; great SF historic decor; spotless; terrific staff; intimate bar and healthy food.
reviews.title: Even better the second time around!
Average
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights after a wedding in Las Vegas.

reviews.title: Great Affordable Location in San Francisco
reviews.text: First problem was unloading the car outside, there was nowhere to park.

reviews.title: Great hotel, great price
reviews.text: Next problem was when booking in, we were informed there was a mistake in the price that we paid directly to the Hotel some 4 months in advance, we were told that it was an extra $160 to pay.

reviews.title: No Question! If you have the chance, stay at the Chancellor
reviews.text: Why in the previous 4 months they could not have informed us is anyones guess, so paying the extra was a big let down.

reviews.title: Hope to come back
reviews.text: Finally when we stopped off in the bar on our last night for a drink we were told the bar was closed, it was 10.45pm.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: I am so happy I consulted Trip Advisor before I booked this hotel last minute. It is in such a great location in Union Square, right next door to Sears -- a wondeful breakfast spot; rooms remind me of an old NYC apartment. So nice and tastefully done. Modernized for today's comfort but not modern. The old touches are still preserved. I can't say enough good things. Staff was very helpful. Would definitely recommend and stay again on our next visit to San Francisco.
reviews.title: A Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As usual, I used Trip Advisor as my final decision when selecting a hotel for our long weekend getaway in San Francisco. Wonderful staff, great location, great room. There are so many options for public transportation within steps of the hotel. On our last day in town, it was raining and the complimentary umbrella came in handy. Of course, the rubber ducky was a cute touch to the room decor! I would stay at the Chancellor again, hands down!
reviews.title: What A Great Stay!
Unbeatable Location and Service
reviews.text: We had a lovely 9 night stay at the Chancellor in May, thanks to Tripadvisor's accurate guest reviews. Thank you Chancellor staff, you're the best! Everything we were looking for in a smaller intimate hotel, about 100 years old: location, location, location, fine service, a charming place for an anniversary trip. We were also in SF for a family wedding at the ritzy St Francis across the street. After studying the different Union Square hotels, we emailed the most promising, requesting a special extended stay quote, and then wrote the Chancellor, asking could they improve on the best offer received, which they did. We were able to stay for 9 nights for less than $1,500. They even had a card & anniversary gift for us. My son and daughter in law also reserved for a shorter stay. They were also delighted & kept saying what a charming hotel (how did you ever find such a gem?). All in all, it was better than we had anticipated. Kudos to the fine staff, who responded promptly & courteously, even providing a small fridge on request. Susan, who effortlessly handles gift shop and concierge duties, arranged for terrific sightseeing trips: wine country, the redwood forest, Monterey and Carmel, Yosemite Natl Park, city sightseeing. We saved so much money on accomodations, we were able to do it all. Airport shuttle is just $14. (Don't forget SF can be chilly & windy even in August. Dress in layers, and Enjoy.)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: (This was a father/son get-away, booked by mom, reviewed by son, and entered by mom!) I found this hotel through T/A and choose it based on reviews. The first morning they were there, I received praise from both saying much they liked it, and that I had made a great choice. Whew! These guys were so impressed with the architecture, the rooms and the staff. Comments on the beds were positive - soft and nicely appointed. Views from the 13th floor were great. They were never hot. The days were pleasant; nights cool. They slept with the window open, with no noise from outside. The bathroom was not roomy, but served the purpose. (This room sounds much like a very special hotel we stayed in on a trip to Edinburgh, Scotland; small but tasteful.) We are so spoiled in this country by mega-motels, and they are nice for certain purposes, but when you want a comfy bed in a stylish environment, at a reasonable price, in a great city, the Chancellor fits the bill.
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was perfect - much better than the tourist trap of the Wharf. The staff was so helpful and friendly. They didn't eat in the hotel, so can't comment on dining. (A great coffee bar around the corner was Cafe La Taza, and for fine ($$$$) dining they went to Farallon, and had a spectacular meal.) The guys thank ya'll for a great weekend, Wes and staff!
reviews.title: Perfect for us

likes.liked: — Architecurally interesting building, quaint, very clean
likes.disliked: — Room wasn't ready at check in, had to wait, then got a different room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Old fashioned hospitality in a perfectly maintained hotel, at a great price, in a top notch area! The employees at this hotel are friendly, helpful and welcoming. Plus the hotel is attractive and clean. The manager should give himself a pat on the back as he obviously knows his job and does it well. Our room looked just like the web site. Starched white bedding against a nice green wall. Looking out our window we could see beautiful Union Square all decked out for Christmas. The elevator worked and was never overly busy. The free coffee in the lobby was better than the diner's next door...and always available (along with cookies and daily newspapers). The free internet in the lobby was helpful as were the people at the front desk who seemed glad to help you find restaurants etc. We didnt eat breakfast at the hotel's restaurant because so many tripadvisors raved about Sears which is next door...so wanted to try that...but saw a very intersting specials board when we got back, and wished we had eaten there instead. The hotel gave us free cable car tickets which we used to go to Fishermans Wharf where we took a boat to Alcatraz. The hotel is in a perfect location for shopping. Saks 5th Ave is across the street and there's a huge Macy's, and too many other stores to name them all...lots of designer shops too. Union Square is sort of in the middle of the city, so every area is within walking distance. We walked to China town, the Embacardo, and Nob Hill.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

likes.liked: — Location and friendly staff & the rubber duck!

reviews.title: Great Hotel!
reviews.text: Just returned from spending three nights at the Chancellor with my sister. Loved the location & found all the staff very friendly.

reviews.title: Excellent Stay at the Chancellor
reviews.text: The rooms are compact but perfect for a great nights sleep. Always felt safe in the hotel.

reviews.title: Small with NO Air Con
reviews.text: The complimentary cookies/popcorn/coffee/tea was appreciated & added such a personal touch to the hotel.

reviews.title: great location/sensational service
reviews.text: Would stay there again!

reviews.title: loved the Chancellor
reviews.text: Pam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005
reviews.text: I stayed at the Chancellor with my girlfriend from the 26-31 march. Our first impression of the hotel was great, excellent location, quick check in, friendly staff. Great coffee and cookies. And a very comfortable room. The bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom very clean, great powerful shower. Down in the lobby you have a bar, gift shop/tour desk, free coffee, restaurant, internet access , what more could you ask for. TY and Alicia working behind the bar were very friendly and informative and great bar tenders. Susan working at the tour desk was very friendly and helpful. And the doormen were extremely efficient especially the guy who has been there for 30 years, Apologies for not knowing his name. Before we even got to the hotel I had exchanged E-Mails with the manager and another staff member Darla Snodgrass, I had requested if they could possibly get me tickets for a concert that I was hoping to see while I was there, this was dealt with efficiently and without fuss, It was just a shame the show was sold out. We read a lot of reviews on here with people going on about the lifts , one lift was out of action but waiting around a few minutes for the lift was not a huge deal , while we were there one of the new lifts opened and this was a lot quicker and held more people. What would help the lift situation would be people who are perfectly fit and healthy and staying on the 2nd 3rd and 4th floors to walk down the stairs rather that stopping the lift. I was staying on the 11th floor and managed to walk down in a few minutes.The location is excellent , right on union square, cable car stop on the corner, walgreen pharmacy open 24hrs on the corner. Within walking distance of all the top shops. All in all this was superb holiday , great hotel , great city and we will certainly return to this hotel.. Happy Holidays.
reviews.title: Excellent. You must stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005, traveled on business
reviews.text: We have stayed here on several occaisions this past year and were never disappointed. The staff is very attentive but low-key. The hotel is well maintained. The rooms are quiet and well appointed. The location is superb. Overall its a great value. It can take time to get your car if you want it between 10 and 11 AM. We look forward to the completion of repairs that will bring elevator #2 back on line. For those who complained about slow checkout, maybe the hotel should offer checkout through the TV like some other hotels do. Wes, you need to lighten up a little on your reaction to some of these reviews. You can't please everyone, but based on this website, you come awful close to it. Keep up the good work.
reviews.title: We are lucky to have this hotel in SF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2005
reviews.text: we stayed their, 27-feb-05 for 4 nights and The hotel is gorgeous, our room was extreamley clean, the decor was nice and modern (plain/fresh looking) and the location is 2nd to none!! we had a brilliant stay in San Francisco only one night when we went out we had our Wallet stolen, which ment we had to cancel all of our credit cards and had very little cash on us, anyway as soon as this happened i went to the front desk to make them aware that if they have not yet already taken the money of off my card that now it will proberbly will not work as i had to cancel them all, basically the hotel people didnt ask if we were ok they just wanted to know how we were going to settle our bill, i think that this was most unconsiderable, as we were thousands of miles away from home with no food, no money and all the hotel cared about was me settling the bill, i mean its not like i couldnt of settled it at a later date. they had all my details so it was not like i was trying to get out of paying. i think that if you had thought more about the safety of your customers rather then there money you would be the best hotel ever. thanks for everything as i was a very nice stay, but i think you should take note of what i have said as this could happen to another customer and if they was not lucky like us, i mean getting money the next day then i dont know what we would have done as you didnt look like you wanted to help us at all
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
Great Location, Wonderful staff
reviews.text: We spent 8 days at the Chancellor on Union Square during February. The hotel is perfectly situated for shopping and touring - there's a huge Macys right across the square. The cable car runs right outside the hotel and goes all the way down to Fisherman's Wharf where you can do loads of things - within the hotel there is a tourist desk where Susan will arrange pick-ups for you - to the airport, coach tours, the lot - she was extremely friendly and very very helpful! We did a tour to Muir Woods - excellent and great views of SF from across the bay in Sausalito!

reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel rooms are clean and although the beds are a bit small; we would have preferred Queens, the overall comfort is great for the price. We thought the little extras like the jar of sweeties and cotton buds in the bathroom were nice and made it seem very homely.

reviews.title: Great Value
reviews.text: This may be the best value in the US for a hotel in the tourist center of a tourist city. The Chancellor has a 1920s feel. The rooms are nothing fancy and on the smaller side, but they have a lot of character. The bathroom, for instance, has a real high-sided tub with shower, not a modern shower. If you want luxurious and up to date, best go elsewhere.

reviews.title: Wonderul Location, Wonderful staff
reviews.text: If you like an older feel and want value, this is the perfect hotel. I booked online and paid $89 (pretax) for my room-- not a special rate. The room had a partial view of Union Square. The wireless access was free-- I was on business and this was very useful. The hotel has an arrangement with a neighbor health club for free use. The staff was friendly and helpful. Everything was clean and well-kept. If I had paid $200 a night, I would have been satisfied. I was almost a little fearful of what I would get for the price, but wow...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel is on the cable car line with stops just outside the door. The ride to Fisherman's Wharf is about 15 minutes and great fun. The hotel is across the street from high end shopping and within walking distance of some great restaurants. The staff was wonderful, they did everything possible to make sure our stay was enjoyable. I have two less than wonderful comments: 1. Our room, 1208, was in need of updating; sad carpeting and bedding. 2. Our room was not air conditioned. This was not a problem since temperatures were mild and we left windows open. However, even on the 12th floor, street noise often was distracting. That said, though small and dated, the room was clean with nice toiletries and two comfy chairs. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I got away for an extended weekend and we were quite pleased with the Chancellor. We booked it on advice from others here at Trip Advisor and we were not let down. The location is superb, the rates are excellent, the staff was friendly, nice and courteous and the rooms were clean (yes, and small). We stayed on the back side of the hotel, no view, but quiet! We loved the cookie tray, pillow menu and rentable room-spa items. Would stay again and highly recommend.
reviews.title: Reminds me of a sultry dorm room
Look no further, book it now!!!
reviews.text: I only stayed here for one night as a vacation day before a business trip. Since my company wasn't paying for the hotel on my day off, I choose to use a discount hotel website that doesn't tell you the name of the hotel before booking. Basically, it is a place to sleep that is indoors. I'm 6'5" and the bed is 5'10". The TV is the exact version my 87 year old grandpa has, except smaller. On a bright note, they had free cookies at the front desk - on a sad note, they were not good. The bathroom is clean, which is always a good thing. The room itself is very small - it reminds me of my dorm room from college, except with uglier carpet. That's about all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A wonderful hotel, great location in a safe, CLEAN area near everything from great restaurants to shopping to public transit to tour starting points. The room was lovely & very clean. Room Service for breakfast (on my birthday) was wonderful.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked the concierge for a restaurant recommendation and he seemed to know minute details of nearly every place in the city and we ended up at a great French place 5 minutes away. Would definitely go back to the Chancellor!
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can't put a price on the history of the Chancellor hotel and surrounding area. The cable cars run right in front of the hotel and you are in easy walking distance of Union Square and tons of restaurants and rental car locations. Starbucks across the street is handy as well. Very nice!
reviews.title: Great Location-Bad Beds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our Babymoon to San Francisco, we had a fantastic time considering I was 28 weeks pregnant. You literally cannot beat the location of the Chancellor Hotel, but be prepared for horrible beds and rude staff. The lady in the lobby (can't remember her name) who helps you with attractions was the best though! It was a mixed bag, but considering the price and value I'd stay there again...
reviews.title: Fabulous Location, Wonderful Staff, Will Definitely Stay Here Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel on Union Square for 4 nights. Everyone we encountered was very helpful and nice. We always felt safe and comfortable.
reviews.title: What a Lovely Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Booked one night at the Chancellor after reading all the positive reviews and walking past it (to get to Sears for breakfast) for years. A good choice - it was clean, it was pretty modern in terms of amenities, the shower was hot & strong, the bed was comfy, and the cable worked. Loved the free wifi option. Rec'd a nice 2 for 1 voucher to the lobby bar with check in, so I had to give that a try - and it was during my second glass of merlot that I realized the lobby was just like a living room. The bartender knew many of the guests and asked how their day went. The reception area offered cookies & fruit, and the comfy sofas offered a good view of the eclectic SF pedestrians. It's right off of Union Square and the shopping opportunities abound. Loads of decent restaurants within walking distance. A bit of a hike to/from BART, but since it was the only exercise I got during this last business trip, it was fine. (I may not have been as pleased if it was raining!) I think I'll stay here again on my next trip...
reviews.title: Lobby is like your living room on Union Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very cool hotel in a perfect location. The staff handled a reservation issue very quickly and without hassle - the way problems should be solved! The rooms are on the small side, but it's not a problem for 2 people. My only complaint was how warm the room got. I'm not sure why it was so warm in the room since it was late October, the heat wasn't on, and it was fairly cool outside. There is no AC so the only way to cool down is to open the windows and turn the ceiling fan on - neither helped much. Once we opened the windows it was quite noisy (it is union square after all). So, between the heat and noise, we didn't sleep well. I would try for a room on the "quiet side" on a higher level to reduce noise if you have to open the windows. Overall, it is a good value and I would recommend it for someone looking for a good value in Union Square.
reviews.title: Quiant Rooms - Great location - Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I came from Israel for a 3 day stay in San Francisco before a wedding. The hotel is clean, the staff is excellent-helpful with every detail needed. There is free coffee, cookies and apples 24/7-just a small friendly part of the general friendly hospitality. The location is perfect- we really loved this hotel and the price was perfect.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i stayed here for 4 nights at the end of september for our 10 year wedding anniversary. We were on a road trip down to LA via the big sur and needed a good start in San Francisco to set us on our way. Booked with trailfinders and were very pleased with the hotel choice. Good service all round, checking in was a breeze , lovely room with a view of Union square , comfortable bed , small yet adequate bathroom. Shower was powerful and considering that it was very warm during our stay the lack of air con was not a problem as the fan above the bed was nice and cooling.
reviews.title: Charming Cosy Hotel in Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the free tea and cookies in reception.
reviews.title: Small but friendly and a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: Great hotel great location! We stayed at the chancellor in Dec of 2005 we booked five rooms for three nights,there was alittle mix up on the rooms.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Excellent experience, couldn't be better
reviews.text: But it was all good Wes Tyler steped up to the plate and the stay was great as was the staff. They looked after our every need and all five couples had A wonderful time. This was the third year at the Chanceller for dec trip and we will be back in Dec of 2006. Thanks again Wes and thanks to your wonderful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: R.H. Stkn Ca.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Chancellor value
reviews.text: We where four, my husband and I and two daughters, the two rooms where connected, Excellent location, excellent staff very helpfull. The rooms where not big and no refrigerator in it but clean carefully every day and have nice decoration. We LOVED our stay, from far the BEST deal in San Francisco if you are going to SF don't miss it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: Great Hotel, Great Location. Only complaint were that the bed was a little worn and tired. Staff was great, location great. Nice little hotel, and best value I have seen in San Francisco.
reviews.title: A+
Great Location Great Value
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in March 2007 after reading reviews by others on Trip Advisor. The hotel was really good value and in a superb location just minutes away from Union Square. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was small but decor was good, bed very comfortable and bathroom fine. A 'walk-in' cupboard was useful for stashing cases and had a safe, ironing board and iron and a portable heater for chilly nights. Just a few yards away was Lori's Diner which was fun and inexpensive and the Sears restaurant with

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the 'world famous l8 pancake breakfast'! Great shopping in the area and the new mall Westfield had an elegant Nordstrum store with a curving escalator right up to the lounge beneath the dome on the 4th floor with comfy seats for a rest between shopping. For those with less to spend try Ross a few stores along for real bargains - also Kaplans govt. surplus store which sells genuine Levi 501's for $27. Don't miss a short walk to Maiden Lane to see a fabulous Frank Lloyd Wright building, and a walk around Chinatown - choose the 'gift supermarket' to buy your souvenirs at rock bottom prices with nobody hassling you.
reviews.title: Fully Satisfied with The Chancellor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Keep a few dollars available for the homeless beggars who sell the newsheet on the streets in this area.
reviews.title: Overrated, but not horrible

likes.disliked: — Room was not as comfortable and spacious as other hotels.

reviews.title: Highly Recommend the Chancellor Hotel on Union Square!!!!
reviews.text: We are middle aged Australians who have travelled extensively. This is for other Aussies who may be visiting San Francisco in the near future and who have an appreciation of the impact of the currency exchange rate. This hotel is excellent value for money. It deserves all of its positive reviews.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007
reviews.text: We stayed four nights in mid Feb after New York and Las Vegas. We had made our booking some months ago using the hotel website and by doing so organised Lorrie's shuttle from the airport which was very easy. Going by other comments on TripAdvisor we requested a queen without connecting door, non smoking and elevated. We received a room on level 15 at the back of the building. Not a great view (had no expectations) but quiet and comfortable, with access to latest movies on the TV system. Free popcorn from the foyer to go with them. You will have heard of the complimentary coffee and tea as well.
reviews.title: It was perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our French family wanted to visit San Francisco so we booked 3 rooms for 2 nights. The room rate was great for San Francisco and included free parking half a block away. You cannot beat the location on Union Square. The rooms were stylish, clean and very comfortable with a choice of pillows. A family member forgot some clothing in the room and they arranged to have it shipped. We will no doubt stay at the Chancellor again.
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's location is as good as it looks, right at Union Sq with cable cars passing outside, the bart/muni within one - three min walk and major shopping stores within one! The rooms are NOT at all tiny, they comfortably sleep two with room enough to accommodate suitcases, shopping etc. They come with free wi-fi, modern flat-screen tvs, plenty of green tea toiletries, bath, shower, in-room safe, large closets, pillow menus, and in our case we were presented with a card and complimentary bottle of bubbly to help celebrate. It's the small touches that count and this hotel has them all. Free tea, coffee & cookies are available in the lobby all day, there's a starbucks on the corner if you prefer something else. Chinatown is about four mins away, there's so much to see close by that we walked everywhere. I wouldn't hesitate to use the hotel again or recommend it to friends; it's clean, warm, charming, staffed with helpful & friendly people and reasonably priced. What else do you need??!!
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Very Comfy Beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Chancellor gives you fantastic service, terrific location, and very clean and comfortable rooms. With the parking package, it's the best deal in the city!
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We started our US/Europe trip here and it was a great city to start in and the hotel was a bonus as well. It is in the middle of the city but is quiet and efficient and friendly. Close to Macys and Bloomingdales, but not too far from anywhere. We did a lot of walking: to Haight/Ashbury, North Beach etc and it was always a pleasure to return to the hotel where the service was discreet and helpful. We ate breakfast in the dining room whre the food was very good and affordable. Great value for money!
reviews.title: Oustanding value in a lovely city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: My sister and I stayed at The Chancellor for 4 nights and found the hotel to be fantastic. However, we didn't spend much time in our room! The beauty of the hotel is its convenience to the transport, the shops and all of the action of Union Square. You will not believe how close you are to everything - brilliant!!
reviews.title: So close to everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005
reviews.text: I stayed here with my wife in late March for 8 days. I was lucky to read the revies beforehand and book this hotel. The location could not be better as it's said here. The standard room was also big enough for a couple. Maybe because there was big closet for your luggage and clothes. I read from other reviews that tho bathroom would be cold, but I didn't realise that it would be freezing! It was really cold in there and we had to keep the floor covered with towels that we could stand in there. There is no heating in the bathroom at all.
reviews.title: Worth every cent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005
reviews.text: I wrote to the hotel beforehand and asked for a view to Unions Square and also a room from upper floors. We got what we asked for. Our room was in the 12th floor and we had the view we asked for. I also asked beforehand if I could book a car through the hotel or if they had any special deals with any car rental companies, but the answer was simply no. So I booked a car from AVIS, but I was quite suprised when I arrived to the hotel and found a big sign on the concierges desk which said "Dollar car available here"...
reviews.title: Perfect-Perfect-Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005
reviews.text: Otherwise the service at the desk was fine. We even got a late checking out when we asked for that. The room was kept clean all the time.
