Well, as clean as one can keep that kind of mattress. The maid also kept our candy cup filled all the time. Only problem with a service was in the restaurant. One mornig we decided to try hotel's breakfast, but didn't do it again. We were in a bit of a hurry to catch a bus and asked the waiter to hurry up. He said no problem. There was only three more couples having breakfast (and two waiters) so it wasn't too much to asked for. We got our breakfast (beside the toasts) and I immediately asked the waiter to bring the check when he could. After 10 minutes we hadn't got our toasts yet (and hadn't got the waiter) and one supervisor (I think) walked by and I asked her for the toasts and she replied that the waiters were only trainees, so it could take a while. So, she did absolutely nothing about that. After 15-20 minutes we had finished our brakfast besides those toasts and finally got our waiter, but no toasts and no check. He didn't apologise when I mentioned about the missing toasts and asked again for the check. He only left for them. Soon we got toast and the check, but we didn't have time to eat the bread anymore.
reviews.title: Believe the good posts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005
reviews.text: As for the brakfast itself, don't bother. For that price you don't have to chew those reheated bacons, but you can go and que to the next door at Sears Fine Food and you'll get a fabulous breakfast! It's really worth to wait 10 minutes in a que. Or maybe you can go to Lorrie's next block, which is good too.
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations and I expected much.
Surprisingly Wonderful!
reviews.text: Because so many have told all the good sides of this hotel I'm not going to repeat them. I only say that this hotel is good value for your money. I would stay here again for certain.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights at the Chancellor in mid-december, and it was perfect for us. The location is excellent, the hotel staff was extremely helpful and the room as advertised.
reviews.title: Great hotel in the perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was small by U.S. standards, but larger than many rooms of comparable quality that I have stayed in in Europe. The room was funished nicely and kept clean by the staff. And anyone who reads reviews on this site or the hotel's website should not be surprised by the small size of the room, as they seem to go out of their way to make sure people understand what type of hotel they are.
reviews.title: A Rough Start...but Recovered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we found everyone at the Chancellor to be very nice and the hotel to be an excellent value. We will stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything we could say has been said...
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel. Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel is a good value for the location.
reviews.title: Good value at the Chancellor
Wonderful stay
reviews.text: We spent two nights at the Chancellor and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The front desk staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful (special thanks to Olga!). Our room was spotless, with contemporary furnishings, flat screen TV, complementary wi fi, and the Union Square location can't be beat. Breakfast at the hotel's restaurant was delicious, and well presented. We will certainly stay here again when we visit SF.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location, location, location. We used public transport from the airport to the hotel, a very short 30 min trip and 5 mins walk up the hill. Cable car stops right outside the hotel and the supermarket next door sells supersaver Muni passes for the public transport (inc cable cars). Breakfast next door at Sears, which was excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent location, Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is convenient for shorter stays. It is slightly dated but clean. Furniture is visibly used, marked & scratched heavily. Bathroom was a major let down. Bath was very dated and marked. On the other hand beds were very comfortable and pillows absolutelly excellent. We had a room at the back so not much noise from outside; however there was noise from other rooms, although neighbours didn't bother us too much.
reviews.title: 3 Stars because of the location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall, it took me about 3 months of reading reviews prior to booking Chancellor, and I think it was a good value for money. Although if we were to visit San Francisco again I think we would try the Fisherman's Wharf.
reviews.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel in GREAT area! (Part 2)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a relatively pleasant stay, with good location that made it easy to travel around San Francisco and a friendly staff, there is also free coffee and tea at the lobby for hotel guests.
reviews.title: Great location, not great hotel.
Excellent!
reviews.text: I've just returned from a 9-night stay at the Chancellor, and I must state that it was fantastic! Before booking the hotel, I read reviews on Trip Advisor, and thought "everyone is going over the top on this one", but having stayed there, I'm joining in the praise-giving!

reviews.title: good value for money
reviews.text: The best bits? It's CHEAP, but you wouldn't think so with the service they provide! The location is out of this world...right on Union Square, on Powell Street (so you can easily get a cable car to Fishermans Wharf) and within walking distance (15-20 mins max) of places like the Moscone Convention Center south of Market. The room was perfectly sized for me - I can't understand why people were saying it was too small, but maybe it would be a stretch with 2 people staying, I don't know. Nice touches included the jar of sweets and the rubber duck - a coffee machine would have been great, if only to wake me up in the morning (as the bed was too comfortable!), but that's only a minor issue as there was coffee available in the reception area. It was also really quiet - despite being in a busy area, I never really had a problem sleeping, and it was certainly in a safe location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2005
reviews.text: Thanks also go to the lady on the Tour Desk, who I probably annoyed too much with my requests for bus tours, sweets, drinks, transfers to the airport etc...but she carried out these requests with no fuss at all.
reviews.title: Value & Location, Location, Location
it was okay
reviews.text: Problems? Nothing major, and certainly nothing to reduce the review by 5 stars to 4. I think most have commented on the fact only one lift works - although on the 11th floor, I never found this a problem at all (no more than 5 minutes waiting), and while I was there, it was clear that everything was being done to accomodate this (e.g. notifying residents), so I can't really call this a problem. However, I did once try to walk to the 11th floor (of 14, I think) and, even as a fit(ish) 20-something, I was really tired by the time I got to the top! Also, room service in the evening was only provided Wed - Sat: I would have liked this to have been provided on other nights, as (travelling alone) I found it really awkward walking into restaurants and asking for a "table for one"...however, there were PLENTY of local restaurants only steps away from the hotel, so I guess it's a business decision - I normally ate my food at the bar, and it didn't appear that the service was over-subscribed, so I guess most people would prefer to eat out at a local restaurant instead. Finally, I wouldn't really book here if you're a smoker (the hotel is completely non-smoking), or if you're looking for a party atmosphere (e.g. a stag night/bachelor party) - go to a cookie-cutter hotel for that!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2005
reviews.text: Overall, great! If I return to SF, I'll certainly return here.
reviews.title: A *MUST STAY* hotel
CHARMING
reviews.text: This hotel scored excellent in every regard...The staff, especially Rory at the front desk and OJ were great!!! Valet parking made it especially easy to check in and out...Great food in the hotel too!!

reviews.title: Very Satisfied
reviews.text: I'll stay there again and again and have already referred some SF regulars from my home town, Monterey. Good value!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A. Krusee
reviews.title: A Great Place on Union Square

likes.disliked: — size of room, but that was expected, so its okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location, updated rooms, and a great staff. They knew it was my anniversary and I got a bottle of champagne on our arrival. Value-wise this hotel can't be beat. The lobby is a bit schmaltzy, but the room was very comfortable. Perfect wi-fi too. I have no complaints and would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great location for shopping!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our recent stay at the Chancellor turned out to be a very pleasant experience and a great value for the money. The reservation clerk at the hotel built a custom package that met our needs perfectly. The room was on a upper floor and faced Powell St., as requested. The rooms here are small (as expected, but it doesn't rain in S. F. in the summer, so who stays in their room!) However, there were multiple amenities, even the promised rubber ducky, the beds were comfy with upgraded linens, the bath was also small, but well-equipped with multiple mirrors, hair dryer, extra towels, etc. and there was a huge closet ! We had a food credit, which we used at the on-site restaurant for breakfast, delicious food and a great server at 7AM in the morning! The desk clerks were exceptionally helpful, always cheerful, and the cookies, tea and coffee were always out. This hotel has free internet service for guests, so we we were able to print out boarding passes very easily and check email too. This hotel is also a short walk/bus/BART to just about anywhere you want to get to and the desk clerks will help you figure it out! We also had a car for part of the stay, the in-and-out was very convenient and the parking garage attendants always pleasant and helpful. I have stayed in several other hotels around Union Square and this one beat them out by a mile!
reviews.title: Highly Recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was excellent. We were in our room less than 15 minutes after arriving at the hotel. We had a couple of drinks in the small lounge. We had two different bartenders. Both of them were very helpful. Told us cool places to go for food and drink. The room is small but very cozy. Plenty large enough for a couple on vacation. The bed was very comfortable. The room had a huge bathtub. Now my girlfriend wants one that size at home. Location is perfect for whatever you want to do in the city. We will definitely be going back to The Chancellor.
reviews.title: great place, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Chancellor was a wonderful hotel to stay at for many reasons. The people there were very friendly and helpful. The location, right near Union Square, was perfect for us. It's an older hotel and although it doesn't have all the amenities of a larger hotel (room service, gym), the small rooms were clean and very comfortable. The price was very reasonable, which included garage space for our car.
reviews.title: Perfect Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights, the staff were efficient & friendly. The apples, water, coffee & cookies are nice touches. The room was a bit worn round the edges but the furnishings & bed were quite stylish & comfortable. I had an adjoining room & the first night was very noisy, the second was fine. The cable cars go past the front windows so it is not peaceful but it is very well situated, close to Union Square & public transport. I would definitely come here again.
reviews.title: Good & comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cannot praise this hotel enough. Staff, Location, Rooms all excellent. The Tour desk was first class for information and booking trips and airport transfer etc. Spent 7 nights here and did something different every day. Right by Cable car stop. Was very sad to leave San Francisco.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Union Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not really familiar with the area but relied on some of the previous reviews. Most were spot on. My wife and I spent a long weekend at the Chancellor Hotel and were pleasantly surprised at being able to get just about anywhere within the city without having to depend on a car. We were able to get to where we wanted to go in the city using just about every mode of transportation within walking distance of this hotel. The room was small but clean, comfy and well maintained. Would have given it a better rating if the room was a bit larger. Everything in the hotel seemed undersized compared to some of the other hotels I have visited, but that's what gives this hotel it's character. Staff was knowledgeable and friendly. Was a plus to be able to buy tix for the cable car, trains, and buses from the lobby. Being downtown, and hopefully not sounding too insensitive, but be prepared to be hit up for change by the local hobos at least three times on every block. Overall we had a very positive experience and probably would stay here again on our next trip to SF.
reviews.title: Nice comfy hotel

description: The BEST LOCATION at the BEST PRICE...The Chancellor Hotel on Union Square is a historical, boutique hotel located in the heart of San Francisco where the Cable Car stops at the door step. Experience the best service and thoughtfull amenities while being surrounded by world class shopping, dining and theaters. From Union Square, ride the Powell Street Cable Car over Nob Hill, past Chinatown and North Beach, to Fisherman's Wharf.
